name: Hatsune Miku (Original)
description: The classic look of Hatsune Miku in her iconic teal pigtails and futuristic schoolgirl outfit, with a silver-gray vest, pleated skirt and glowing teal accents:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}. This is the design that started it all, capturing Miku’s cheerful and trendy style.

name: Hatsune Miku V2 (Classic)
description: Miku’s classic 2007 look from the VOCALOID2 era. She wears the original black and teal outfit – a sleek vest, turquoise tie, pleated skirt and high boots – embodying the definitive image that made her a virtual pop idol.

name: Hatsune Miku Append
description: An ethereal upgrade of Miku’s design with a futuristic twist – translucent sleeves, glowing accents and a sleek white-and-black outfit give Append Miku a softly luminescent, otherworldly charm:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.

name: Sakura Miku (Cherries)
description: A delightful cherry blossom-themed Miku with pink hair and cherry hair-ties. Sakura Miku’s outfit is a pink recolor of her default costume adorned with flower motifs and even cherries forming a bow – a look that sends your heart soaring with feelings of spring:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.

name: Sakura Miku (Blossom Ponytails)
description: Another variant of Sakura Miku sporting flowing petal-pink twin-tails with white blossom patterns. Her cherry blossom uniform features extra floral accents and long ribbon ties, making this spring Miku look like a living sakura fairy.

name: Easter Bunny Miku
description: Miku dresses up as a cute Easter bunny, complete with bunny ears and a pastel-colored outfit. She exudes springtime cheer – imagine her holding a basket of eggs and hopping along to spread Easter joy in this adorable ensemble.

name: Seifuku Miku (Sailor School Uniform)
description: Miku in a classic Japanese sailor-style school uniform. With a navy blue pleated skirt, white sailor-collared top, and youthful energy, this look captures Miku’s charming high-school vibe perfectly:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

name: Deep-Sea Girl Miku
description: A melancholic underwater-themed Miku clad in an elegant deep blue dress. Her hair flows like the ocean currents around her, and the outfit’s frills and gradients evoke the image of a girl singing alone at the bottom of the sea.

name: Black Rock Shooter
description: A crossover variant with Miku taking on the persona of Black★Rock Shooter. She wears a sleek black coat, short shorts, and blazing blue eye – a fierce and cool alter-ego that melds Miku’s voice with a rockin’ combat-ready style:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.

name: Hachune Miku
description: The chibi parody of Miku with a simplified face and a constant open-mouthed smile. Hachune Miku is often seen waving a spring onion (negi) enthusiastically, embodying a meme-worthy and adorable side of Miku’s character:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

name: Miku (China Version)
description: Hatsune Miku’s Chinese-themed attire featuring a chic cheongsam-inspired dress in white and red. This version often has floral motifs and flowing sleeves, reflecting a blend of modern pop idol and traditional Chinese elegance.

name: The Intense Voice of Hatsune Miku (Gekishou)
description: A module designed for the notoriously difficult song “Hatsune Miku no Gekishou.” Miku appears almost like a digital diva vampire – a frilled gothic outfit, dramatic black-and-red color scheme, and an intense aura to match the song’s extreme energy:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

name: World Is Mine Miku
description: Inspired by the famous song, this Miku wears a princess-like look: a frilly black dress, red rose accessories, and a tiny crown perched in her hair. She looks every bit the spoiled queen of the world lounging on her plush bed, as in the original PV.

name: Rolling Girl Miku
description: A subdued, emotional style for the song “Rolling Girl.” Miku is depicted in a school uniform with bandages wrapping her arms – reflecting the song’s themes of struggle. Her usual bright colors are muted, showing a more troubled side of Miku’s persona.

name: Ghost Rule Miku
description: A darker, stylish Miku outfit themed after DECO*27’s song “Ghost Rule.” She sports a black and red ensemble with thigh-high boots and fingerless gloves. Her expression and pose hint at secrecy and frustration, matching the song’s edgy mood.

name: Yowane Haku
description: Not exactly Miku – Haku is a fan-created character with a moody twist on Miku’s design:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}. She has silvery-white hair in a low ponytail, tired red eyes, and a grey-and-purple version of Miku’s outfit. Her look gives off a wistful, “failed idol” vibe that contrasts with Miku’s pep.

name: Nurse Miku (Love-Colored Ward)
description: Dressed as a cute nurse from the song “Love-Colored Ward,” Miku wears a white nurse uniform complete with a little hat and a pink apron. The outfit is accented with hearts and medical cross symbols, giving a playful hospital theme to Miku’s normally trendy style:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

name: Senbonzakura Miku
description: A Taisho-era military uniform look from the hit song “Senbonzakura.” Miku dons a deep magenta kimono-style military outfit with a matching officer’s cap, white gloves and boots. The costume is adorned with cherry blossom emblems – a striking blend of retro and modern that captures the song’s spirit:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.

name: Saihate Miku (The farthest end)
description: A somber funeral-inspired look from the song “Saihate.” Miku wears a modest black mourning dress complete with a veil. This outfit gives her a graceful, bittersweet appearance – as if she’s attending a final farewell, perfectly capturing the song’s melancholic tone.

name: Sand Planet (Suna no Wakusei) Miku
description: Designed by artist Hachi for the song “Sand Planet,” this Miku braves a desert world. She wears tattered desert garb – earth-toned cloak, boots, and a desert hat – with a gas mask around her neck. The sand-swept, post-apocalyptic style sets her apart from her usual pop image.

name: Alien Alien Miku
description: A quirky space-alien themed Miku inspired by the song “Alien Alien.” She sports a whimsical outfit with antenna-like twin-tails accessories and vibrant neon colors. Miku looks like an adorable extraterrestrial idol ready to sing and invade hearts.

name: Dark Angel (Secret Police)
description: A gothic lolita-style Miku from the “Secret Police” module:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}. She wears a frilly black dress with lace, paired with dark wings and a halo. The look is both cute and dark, perfectly matching the secretive, rebellious vibe of the song.

name: March Hare Miku
description: A Wonderland-inspired costume where Miku takes on the guise of the March Hare. She wears a frilly outfit with bunny ears and tea party accessories. This whimsical style shortens Miku’s twintails and gives her a playful, slightly madcap look straight out of Alice’s world:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

name: Lollipop Miku
description: A candy-sweet module from Project DIVA X, featuring Miku in a pastel, lolita-like outfit adorned with candy motifs. She looks like a human confection, with striped stockings and a giant lollipop prop – perfectly suited to upbeat, playful songs:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}.

name: Maneki Miku (Lucky Cat)
description: Miku transforms into a lucky cat! She wears a traditional-style outfit with cat ears, a bell collar and a paw-like pose reminiscent of a maneki neko statue. With a red and white kimono and cute cat tail, this Miku promises to bring good fortune:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}.

name: Miku Symphony 2017 (Ball Gown)
description: An elegant symphonic concert outfit based on KEI’s illustration for Miku Symphony 2017:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}. Miku appears in a chic black ball gown with blue lining, holding a violin. The sophisticated dress and refined smile give her a graceful, orchestra-soloist presence.

name: Miku Symphony 2018 (Maid)
description: The outfit from Miku Symphony 2018 gives Miku a demure, classical look akin to a Victorian maid or orchestra attendant. She wears a black-and-white dress with apron-like frills and musical motifs. It’s a charming blend of cute and formal, fitting for an orchestral concert setting.

name: Miku Symphony 2020 (5th Anniversary)
description: For the 5th Anniversary of Miku Symphony, Miku wears a special celebratory dress drawn by artist Rella:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}. It’s a white and sky-blue gown adorned with musical notes and stars. She looks like a princess on stage, commemorating five years of symphonic performances.

name: Hatsune Miku if ver.
description: This design is based on Miku’s original concept art – a what-if version where she has a different outfit and even slightly brown hair:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}. Miku if Ver. wears a stylish school-uniform-inspired dress with teal accents, offering fans a glimpse of an alternate Miku that might have been.

name: Hatsune Miku: Winter Live
description: An outfit worn for a special winter concert. Miku is bundled in a festive white coat with blue snowflake motifs, a fluffy scarf, and matching earmuffs. She looks warm and radiant on stage, ready to perform in a winter wonderland.

name: Birthday Miku (2019 Blue)
description: A celebratory outfit from Miku’s 12th birthday in 2019. Miku wears a frilly blue party dress with ribbons and bows, as seen in the official birthday illustration. She even holds a decorated birthday cake, overflowing with cheerful charm to mark the special day.

name: Bottle Miku
description: A tiny, whimsical Miku derivative who literally lives in a bottle! This fan-made character has Miku with flowing liquid-blue hair enclosed inside a transparent bottle. It’s an adorable concept that imagines Miku as a magical genie or spirit in a bottle:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}.

name: Shiteyan'yo (Legs Miku)
description: A bizarre and humorous Miku derivative consisting of Miku’s head atop a pair of human legs:contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}. Shiteyan’yo is bright pink and utterly strange, born from internet humor. Though unsettling, she’s a beloved meme – a testament to Vocaloid fandom’s quirky creativity.

name: Love Is War
description: Miku’s attire from the song “Love is War.” She stands atop towering speakers, wearing a tattered black dress and a long flowing scarf. With a megaphone in hand and distressed, passionate styling, this look captures the intense, rebellious emotion of the song’s story.

name: Sweet Pumpkin Miku
description: A Halloween-themed module where Miku dresses up as a cute pumpkin witch:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}. She wears an orange and purple dress with pumpkin motifs, striped witch hat, and carries a jack-o’-lantern. Sweet Pumpkin Miku is full of Halloween cheer and sugary mischief.

name: Snow Miku 2011 (Fluffy Coat)
description: The 2011 Snow Miku dons a fluffy white winter coat and earmuffs, looking warm and noble in the snowy Sapporo winter:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}. Pink accents and a soft scarf complete this early Snow Miku design, bringing cozy cheer to the cold.

name: Snow Miku 2012 (Scarf)
description: Snow Miku 2012 wears a warm light-blue coat with a fluffy hood and pom-pom ties, earning her the “Fluffy Coat” nickname:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}. She carries the charm of winter with snowflake designs on her outfit and her hair turned silvery white.

name: Snow Miku 2013 (Strawberry White Kimono)
description: The 2013 Snow Miku appears in a pure white kimono adorned with strawberries and floral patterns. This “Strawberry White Kimono” design gives Miku a serene, traditional beauty, celebrating winter through a blend of snow and spring imagery.

name: Snow Miku 2014 (Magical Snow)
description: Snow Miku 2014 takes on a magical girl motif – “Magical Snow.” She wears a cape and wizard hat decorated with stars and snowflakes, wielding a snowflake staff. This enchanting outfit turns Miku into a winter sorceress twinkling with frost magic.

name: Snow Miku 2015 (Snow Bell)
description: The 2015 Snow Miku, called “Snow Bell,” is themed around lily-of-the-valley flowers:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}. Dressed in a white bell-shaped dress with green ribbons and fur trim, she embodies a gentle spirit of the snow, ready to warm you up in time for spring:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}.

name: Snow Miku 2016 (Snow Owl Parka)
description: Snow Miku 2016 is winter-sports themed – she wears a cozy blue and white parka with pink accents, plus ski goggles and an owl motif on her hat. “Snow Owl Parka” Miku looks ready to hit the slopes, keeping things frosty and fun with her adventurous snow style:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.

name: Snow Miku 2017 (Twinkle Constellations)
description: The 2017 Snow Miku, “Twinkle Constellations,” has a celestial theme. She is robed in a midnight blue cape adorned with constellations, and her outfit sparkles like the night sky over snowy fields. This design blends winter and starry wonder into one twinkling ensemble.

name: Snow Miku 2018 (Crane Priestess)
description: Snow Miku 2018 is known as the “Crane Priestess.” She wears a traditional Japanese miko (shrine maiden) outfit with rich red and white colors, accented by crane-inspired details. This graceful design celebrates Hokkaido’s wildlife and winter spirituality.

name: Snow Miku 2019 (Princess)
description: The 2019 Snow Miku appears as a “Snow Princess.” Dressed in an elegant ice-blue ball gown and a tiara, she looks every bit royalty of the winter. The outfit’s layered frills and snowflake ornaments give Miku a regal and frosty charm.

name: Snow Miku 2020 (Marching Orchestra)
description: Snow Miku 2020 marches in with a marching-band inspired outfit, hence “Marching Orchestra.” She wears a smart military jacket, music note motifs and a plumed hat. Leading a parade through the snow, this design is festive and full of musical energy.

name: Snow Miku 2021 (Illumination)
description: Snow Miku 2021 shines with an “Illumination” theme. Her outfit is decorated with lights and motifs of winter illuminations – glowing bulbs, city skyline patterns, and twinkling stars. She represents the warm festive lights that brighten up long winter nights.

name: Snow Miku 2022 (Hokkaido Sea)
description: The 2022 Snow Miku is themed around the winter sea of Hokkaido. Her costume incorporates ocean blues, pearls and marine elements like seashell accessories. With flowing wave-like sleeves and aquatic accents, she brings the serene beauty of Hokkaido’s winter coast to life.

name: Rin Style (Miku as Rin)
description: Miku cosplaying as Rin, adopting Rin’s trademark outfit. She wears a yellow and black Kagamine Rin outfit, complete with her signature ribbon, effectively becoming a version of Rin but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Len Style (Miku as Len)
description: Miku cosplaying as Len, adopting Kagamine Len’s costume with its white sailor-style top and shorts, plus a cool necktie, effectively becoming a version of Len but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Luka Style (Miku as Luka)
description: Miku cosplaying as Luka, adopting Megurine Luka’s elegant attire – a black and gold dress with midriff-baring top, bringing out a mature charm, effectively becoming a version of Luka but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: MEIKO Style (Miku as MEIKO)
description: Miku cosplaying as MEIKO, adopting MEIKO’s red outfit, including a midriff top and skirt, mirroring MEIKO’s classic style from the early days, effectively becoming a version of MEIKO but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: KAITO Style (Miku as KAITO)
description: Miku cosplaying as KAITO, adopting KAITO’s long blue coat and scarf ensemble, instantly recognizable to fans of the blue-haired Vocaloid, effectively becoming a version of KAITO but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Teto Style (Miku as Teto)
description: Miku cosplaying as Teto, adopting Kasane Teto’s pink twin-drill style – Miku wears Teto’s outfit and even sports faux drill curls to match, effectively becoming a version of Teto but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: GUMI Style (Miku as GUMI)
description: Miku cosplaying as GUMI, adopting GUMI’s orange crop-top and skirt set with green accents and goggles, capturing GUMI’s lively, warm vibe, effectively becoming a version of GUMI but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Hatsune Miku 10th Anniversary (Pearl Ver.)
description: A special outfit celebrating Miku’s 10th anniversary. Miku wears a pearlescent white dress inspired by her original costume, decorated with rainbow ribbons and the number ‘10’. This anniversary design by KEI gives her a festive, commemorative glow.

name: Fairy Miku (3rd Spring)
description: Miku takes on the form of a spring fairy. She is adorned in a light green dress with flower petals and butterfly-like wings. This enchanting look imagines Miku as a tiny seasonal fairy bringing in the spring bloom.

name: Hatsune Miku: Heart×Ribbon
description: A cute and girly module featuring Miku in a pink, heart-themed outfit designed by Suoh. She has large ribbon ornaments in her hair and heart motifs on her dress and boots. This look is overflowing with idol-like charm and sweet, romantic style.

name: Harvest Moon Miku
description: A serene autumn-themed outfit. Miku is dressed in a traditional harvest festival kimono with moon and rabbit motifs. The warm earthy colors and gentle design evoke the feeling of watching a harvest moon on a cool autumn night with Miku by your side.

name: Leo/need Miku
description: A version of Miku as she appears in the Leo/need band of Project SEKAI. She wears a casual school band outfit – a stylish school uniform with a light cardigan and sneakers. This look highlights Miku’s approachable, band-member side when performing with Leo/need.

name: MiCrystal (Crystal Miku)
description: A sparkling module where Miku appears as if sculpted from crystal. Her outfit is translucent and faceted like a gemstone, refracting light into rainbows. MiCrystal Miku looks like a delicate glass statue come to life, singing with a pure, crystal-clear tone.

name: Odds and Ends Miku
description: This outfit comes from ryo’s song “ODDS&ENDS.” Miku is shown in a humble mechanic-style getup – a simple white tank top, work gloves, and boots – surrounded by tools and broken robot parts. It’s a poignant look that underscores Miku’s role as a scrapped, rebuilt robot singing her heart out.

name: Rabbit Hole Miku
description: A fantastical, Alice-in-Wonderland inspired Miku. She wears a checkered dress and striped stockings, looking as if she’s just tumbled down the rabbit hole into a strange new world. This whimsical outfit blends curiosity and a hint of madness, with playing card motifs and a pocket watch accessory.

name: Romeo and Cinderella Miku
description: From the song “Romeo and Cinderella,” Miku wears a vintage ball gown. It’s a lovely Victorian-style dress in shades of white and deep blue (as seen in the PV) with lace gloves. This attire makes Miku look like the tragic heroine of a fairy tale, longing for love at midnight.

name: Miku (Winter Image)
description: A general winter illustration style for Miku. She’s bundled in a cozy coat with fur trim, wearing earmuffs and mittens. This winter image Miku might be depicted standing in softly falling snow under streetlights, capturing the gentle and calm atmosphere of a winter night.

name: Tell Your World Miku
description: Miku’s outfit from the iconic Google Chrome CM song “Tell Your World.” She wears a colorful street-fashion ensemble with a multi-layered tutu skirt splashed in rainbow paint colors:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}. A large pair of headphones around her neck completes this artistic, world-connected look.

name: Sakura no Ame Miku (Cherry-Petal Uniform)
description: From the graduation song “Sakura no Ame,” Miku is portrayed in a Japanese high school graduation uniform. She wears a pink cherry-blossom colored blazer and skirt with a red ribbon, standing under falling sakura petals. This look is sentimental and gentle, representing farewells and new beginnings in spring.

name: Zatsune Miku
description: Miku’s infamous dark counterpart. Zatsune Miku has long black hair with red highlights instead of teal, red eyes, and a black variation of Miku’s outfit. She emanates a sinister aura – an alternate, more hostile personality of Miku born from fan imagination:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}.

name: Magical Mirai 2013 (Magician Top-Hat)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2013. Miku acts as a magical circus magician, complete with a silk top hat, cape and wand. She looks ready to dazzle the crowd with stage magic and song.

name: Magical Mirai 2014 (Future Ribbon)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2014. A futuristic outfit characterized by an oversized ribbon that ties her hair. The design blends a sci-fi feel with cute idol elements, representing Miku’s ever-evolving future.

name: Magical Mirai 2015 (Plaid Crown)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2015. Miku wears a plaid-themed outfit with a crown or tiara. The plaid pattern adds a modern pop style, and the small crown signifies her status as the queen of the event.

name: Magical Mirai 2016 (Blue Parade)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2016. A marching band style costume in royal blue. Miku looks like a parade drum major, leading the celebration in a military-style jacket and parade hat decorated in blue.

name: Magical Mirai 2017 (Sailor Lab)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2017. A unique concept mixing a sailor-style school uniform with a science lab coat. Miku’s outfit has sailor collar and pleats alongside technical, lab-like details, symbolizing both youth and innovation.

name: Magical Mirai 2018 (Harlequin Circus)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2018. This design gives Miku a playful circus performer look. She has harlequin diamond patterns on her dress, a jester-like collar, and colorful circus-themed accessories, embodying the carnival atmosphere.

name: Magical Mirai 2019 (Star Crown)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2019. Miku’s outfit features star motifs and she wears a shining star crown on her head. The costume is elegant and cosmic, celebrating the theme of stars and guidance as Magical Mirai hits new heights.

name: Magical Mirai 2020 (Marching Band)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2020. Mirroring a band leader’s attire with a bright red marching band uniform and a plume hat. Despite the challenges of 2020, this outfit exudes determination and unity through music.

name: Magical Mirai 2021 (Future Lab)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2021. Miku dons a sleek white and teal outfit resembling a science lab coat fused with futuristic fashion. Goggles and techy patterns accent the design, capturing the forward-looking spirit of that year’s event.

name: Magical Mirai 2022 (10th Anniv. Pastel)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2022. For Magical Mirai’s 10th anniversary, Miku wears a soft pastel-colored ensemble that incorporates elements from past years’ designs. It’s a celebratory, all-star outfit – pastel rainbow dress, anniversary logo, and joyful nods to her decade of Magical Mirai.

description: The classic look of Hatsune Miku in her iconic teal pigtails and futuristic schoolgirl outfit, with a silver-gray vest, pleated skirt and glowing teal accents:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}. This is the design that started it all, capturing Miku’s cheerful and trendy style.

description: A gothic lolita-style Miku from the “Secret Police” module:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}. She wears a frilly black dress with lace, paired with dark wings and a halo. The look is both cute and dark, perfectly matching the secretive, rebellious vibe of the song.

name: March Hare Miku
description: A Wonderland-inspired costume where Miku takes on the guise of the March Hare. She wears a frilly outfit with bunny ears and tea party accessories. This whimsical style shortens Miku’s twintails and gives her a playful, slightly madcap look straight out of Alice’s world:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

name: Lollipop Miku
description: A candy-sweet module from Project DIVA X, featuring Miku in a pastel, lolita-like outfit adorned with candy motifs. She looks like a human confection, with striped stockings and a giant lollipop prop – perfectly suited to upbeat, playful songs:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}.

name: Maneki Miku (Lucky Cat)
description: Miku transforms into a lucky cat! She wears a traditional-style outfit with cat ears, a bell collar and a paw-like pose reminiscent of a maneki neko statue. With a red and white kimono and cute cat tail, this Miku promises to bring good fortune:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}.

name: Miku Symphony 2017 (Ball Gown)
description: An elegant symphonic concert outfit based on KEI’s illustration for Miku Symphony 2017:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}. Miku appears in a chic black ball gown with blue lining, holding a violin. The sophisticated dress and refined smile give her a graceful, orchestra-soloist presence.

name: Miku Symphony 2018 (Maid)
description: The outfit from Miku Symphony 2018 gives Miku a demure, classical look akin to a Victorian maid or orchestra attendant. She wears a black-and-white dress with apron-like frills and musical motifs. It’s a charming blend of cute and formal, fitting for an orchestral concert setting.

name: Miku Symphony 2020 (5th Anniversary)
description: For the 5th Anniversary of Miku Symphony, Miku wears a special celebratory dress drawn by artist Rella:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}. It’s a white and sky-blue gown adorned with musical notes and stars. She looks like a princess on stage, commemorating five years of symphonic performances.

name: Hatsune Miku if ver.
description: This design is based on Miku’s original concept art – a what-if version where she has a different outfit and even slightly brown hair:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}. Miku if Ver. wears a stylish school-uniform-inspired dress with teal accents, offering fans a glimpse of an alternate Miku that might have been.

name: Hatsune Miku: Winter Live
description: An outfit worn for a special winter concert. Miku is bundled in a festive white coat with blue snowflake motifs, a fluffy scarf, and matching earmuffs. She looks warm and radiant on stage, ready to perform in a winter wonderland.

name: Birthday Miku (2019 Blue)
description: A celebratory outfit from Miku’s 12th birthday in 2019. Miku wears a frilly blue party dress with ribbons and bows, as seen in the official birthday illustration. She even holds a decorated birthday cake, overflowing with cheerful charm to mark the special day.

name: Bottle Miku
description: A tiny, whimsical Miku derivative who literally lives in a bottle! This fan-made character has Miku with flowing liquid-blue hair enclosed inside a transparent bottle. It’s an adorable concept that imagines Miku as a magical genie or spirit in a bottle:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}.

name: Shiteyan'yo (Legs Miku)
description: A bizarre and humorous Miku derivative consisting of Miku’s head atop a pair of human legs:contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}. Shiteyan’yo is bright pink and utterly strange, born from internet humor. Though unsettling, she’s a beloved meme – a testament to Vocaloid fandom’s quirky creativity.

name: Love Is War
description: Miku’s attire from the song “Love is War.” She stands atop towering speakers, wearing a tattered black dress and a long flowing scarf. With a megaphone in hand and distressed, passionate styling, this look captures the intense, rebellious emotion of the song’s story.

name: Sweet Pumpkin Miku
description: A Halloween-themed module where Miku dresses up as a cute pumpkin witch:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}. She wears an orange and purple dress with pumpkin motifs, striped witch hat, and carries a jack-o’-lantern. Sweet Pumpkin Miku is full of Halloween cheer and sugary mischief.

name: Snow Miku 2011 (Fluffy Coat)
description: The 2011 Snow Miku dons a fluffy white winter coat and earmuffs, looking warm and noble in the snowy Sapporo winter:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}. Pink accents and a soft scarf complete this early Snow Miku design, bringing cozy cheer to the cold.

name: Snow Miku 2012 (Scarf)
description: Snow Miku 2012 wears a warm light-blue coat with a fluffy hood and pom-pom ties, earning her the “Fluffy Coat” nickname:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}. She carries the charm of winter with snowflake designs on her outfit and her hair turned silvery white.

name: Snow Miku 2013 (Strawberry White Kimono)
description: The 2013 Snow Miku appears in a pure white kimono adorned with strawberries and floral patterns. This “Strawberry White Kimono” design gives Miku a serene, traditional beauty, celebrating winter through a blend of snow and spring imagery.

name: Snow Miku 2014 (Magical Snow)
description: Snow Miku 2014 takes on a magical girl motif – “Magical Snow.” She wears a cape and wizard hat decorated with stars and snowflakes, wielding a snowflake staff. This enchanting outfit turns Miku into a winter sorceress twinkling with frost magic.

name: Snow Miku 2015 (Snow Bell)
description: The 2015 Snow Miku, called “Snow Bell,” is themed around lily-of-the-valley flowers:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}. Dressed in a white bell-shaped dress with green ribbons and fur trim, she embodies a gentle spirit of the snow, ready to warm you up in time for spring:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}.

name: Snow Miku 2016 (Snow Owl Parka)
description: Snow Miku 2016 is winter-sports themed – she wears a cozy blue and white parka with pink accents, plus ski goggles and an owl motif on her hat. “Snow Owl Parka” Miku looks ready to hit the slopes, keeping things frosty and fun with her adventurous snow style:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.

name: Snow Miku 2017 (Twinkle Constellations)
description: The 2017 Snow Miku, “Twinkle Constellations,” has a celestial theme. She is robed in a midnight blue cape adorned with constellations, and her outfit sparkles like the night sky over snowy fields. This design blends winter and starry wonder into one twinkling ensemble.

name: Snow Miku 2018 (Crane Priestess)
description: Snow Miku 2018 is known as the “Crane Priestess.” She wears a traditional Japanese miko (shrine maiden) outfit with rich red and white colors, accented by crane-inspired details. This graceful design celebrates Hokkaido’s wildlife and winter spirituality.

name: Snow Miku 2019 (Princess)
description: The 2019 Snow Miku appears as a “Snow Princess.” Dressed in an elegant ice-blue ball gown and a tiara, she looks every bit royalty of the winter. The outfit’s layered frills and snowflake ornaments give Miku a regal and frosty charm.

name: Snow Miku 2020 (Marching Orchestra)
description: Snow Miku 2020 marches in with a marching-band inspired outfit, hence “Marching Orchestra.” She wears a smart military jacket, music note motifs and a plumed hat. Leading a parade through the snow, this design is festive and full of musical energy.

name: Snow Miku 2021 (Illumination)
description: Snow Miku 2021 shines with an “Illumination” theme. Her outfit is decorated with lights and motifs of winter illuminations – glowing bulbs, city skyline patterns, and twinkling stars. She represents the warm festive lights that brighten up long winter nights.

name: Snow Miku 2022 (Hokkaido Sea)
description: The 2022 Snow Miku is themed around the winter sea of Hokkaido. Her costume incorporates ocean blues, pearls and marine elements like seashell accessories. With flowing wave-like sleeves and aquatic accents, she brings the serene beauty of Hokkaido’s winter coast to life.

name: Rin Style (Miku as Rin)
description: Miku cosplaying as Rin, adopting Rin’s trademark outfit. She wears a yellow and black Kagamine Rin outfit, complete with her signature ribbon, effectively becoming a version of Rin but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Len Style (Miku as Len)
description: Miku cosplaying as Len, adopting Kagamine Len’s costume with its white sailor-style top and shorts, plus a cool necktie, effectively becoming a version of Len but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Luka Style (Miku as Luka)
description: Miku cosplaying as Luka, adopting Megurine Luka’s elegant attire – a black and gold dress with midriff-baring top, bringing out a mature charm, effectively becoming a version of Luka but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: MEIKO Style (Miku as MEIKO)
description: Miku cosplaying as MEIKO, adopting MEIKO’s red outfit, including a midriff top and skirt, mirroring MEIKO’s classic style from the early days, effectively becoming a version of MEIKO but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: KAITO Style (Miku as KAITO)
description: Miku cosplaying as KAITO, adopting KAITO’s long blue coat and scarf ensemble, instantly recognizable to fans of the blue-haired Vocaloid, effectively becoming a version of KAITO but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Teto Style (Miku as Teto)
description: Miku cosplaying as Teto, adopting Kasane Teto’s pink twin-drill style – Miku wears Teto’s outfit and even sports faux drill curls to match, effectively becoming a version of Teto but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: GUMI Style (Miku as GUMI)
description: Miku cosplaying as GUMI, adopting GUMI’s orange crop-top and skirt set with green accents and goggles, capturing GUMI’s lively, warm vibe, effectively becoming a version of GUMI but with Miku’s face – a fun crossover style beloved by fans.

name: Hatsune Miku 10th Anniversary (Pearl Ver.)
description: A special outfit celebrating Miku’s 10th anniversary. Miku wears a pearlescent white dress inspired by her original costume, decorated with rainbow ribbons and the number ‘10’. This anniversary design by KEI gives her a festive, commemorative glow.

name: Fairy Miku (3rd Spring)
description: Miku takes on the form of a spring fairy. She is adorned in a light green dress with flower petals and butterfly-like wings. This enchanting look imagines Miku as a tiny seasonal fairy bringing in the spring bloom.

name: Hatsune Miku: Heart×Ribbon
description: A cute and girly module featuring Miku in a pink, heart-themed outfit designed by Suoh. She has large ribbon ornaments in her hair and heart motifs on her dress and boots. This look is overflowing with idol-like charm and sweet, romantic style.

name: Harvest Moon Miku
description: A serene autumn-themed outfit. Miku is dressed in a traditional harvest festival kimono with moon and rabbit motifs. The warm earthy colors and gentle design evoke the feeling of watching a harvest moon on a cool autumn night with Miku by your side.

name: Leo/need Miku
description: A version of Miku as she appears in the Leo/need band of Project SEKAI. She wears a casual school band outfit – a stylish school uniform with a light cardigan and sneakers. This look highlights Miku’s approachable, band-member side when performing with Leo/need.

name: MiCrystal (Crystal Miku)
description: A sparkling module where Miku appears as if sculpted from crystal. Her outfit is translucent and faceted like a gemstone, refracting light into rainbows. MiCrystal Miku looks like a delicate glass statue come to life, singing with a pure, crystal-clear tone.

name: Odds and Ends Miku
description: This outfit comes from ryo’s song “ODDS&ENDS.” Miku is shown in a humble mechanic-style getup – a simple white tank top, work gloves, and boots – surrounded by tools and broken robot parts. It’s a poignant look that underscores Miku’s role as a scrapped, rebuilt robot singing her heart out.

name: Rabbit Hole Miku
description: A fantastical, Alice-in-Wonderland inspired Miku. She wears a checkered dress and striped stockings, looking as if she’s just tumbled down the rabbit hole into a strange new world. This whimsical outfit blends curiosity and a hint of madness, with playing card motifs and a pocket watch accessory.

name: Romeo and Cinderella Miku
description: From the song “Romeo and Cinderella,” Miku wears a vintage ball gown. It’s a lovely Victorian-style dress in shades of white and deep blue (as seen in the PV) with lace gloves. This attire makes Miku look like the tragic heroine of a fairy tale, longing for love at midnight.

name: Miku (Winter Image)
description: A general winter illustration style for Miku. She’s bundled in a cozy coat with fur trim, wearing earmuffs and mittens. This winter image Miku might be depicted standing in softly falling snow under streetlights, capturing the gentle and calm atmosphere of a winter night.

name: Tell Your World Miku
description: Miku’s outfit from the iconic Google Chrome CM song “Tell Your World.” She wears a colorful street-fashion ensemble with a multi-layered tutu skirt splashed in rainbow paint colors:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}. A large pair of headphones around her neck completes this artistic, world-connected look.

name: Sakura no Ame Miku (Cherry-Petal Uniform)
description: From the graduation song “Sakura no Ame,” Miku is portrayed in a Japanese high school graduation uniform. She wears a pink cherry-blossom colored blazer and skirt with a red ribbon, standing under falling sakura petals. This look is sentimental and gentle, representing farewells and new beginnings in spring.

name: Zatsune Miku
description: Miku’s infamous dark counterpart. Zatsune Miku has long black hair with red highlights instead of teal, red eyes, and a black variation of Miku’s outfit. She emanates a sinister aura – an alternate, more hostile personality of Miku born from fan imagination:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}.

name: Magical Mirai 2013 (Magician Top-Hat)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2013. Miku acts as a magical circus magician, complete with a silk top hat, cape and wand. She looks ready to dazzle the crowd with stage magic and song.

name: Magical Mirai 2014 (Future Ribbon)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2014. A futuristic outfit characterized by an oversized ribbon that ties her hair. The design blends a sci-fi feel with cute idol elements, representing Miku’s ever-evolving future.

name: Magical Mirai 2015 (Plaid Crown)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2015. Miku wears a plaid-themed outfit with a crown or tiara. The plaid pattern adds a modern pop style, and the small crown signifies her status as the queen of the event.

name: Magical Mirai 2016 (Blue Parade)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2016. A marching band style costume in royal blue. Miku looks like a parade drum major, leading the celebration in a military-style jacket and parade hat decorated in blue.

name: Magical Mirai 2017 (Sailor Lab)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2017. A unique concept mixing a sailor-style school uniform with a science lab coat. Miku’s outfit has sailor collar and pleats alongside technical, lab-like details, symbolizing both youth and innovation.

name: Magical Mirai 2018 (Harlequin Circus)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2018. This design gives Miku a playful circus performer look. She has harlequin diamond patterns on her dress, a jester-like collar, and colorful circus-themed accessories, embodying the carnival atmosphere.

name: Magical Mirai 2019 (Star Crown)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2019. Miku’s outfit features star motifs and she wears a shining star crown on her head. The costume is elegant and cosmic, celebrating the theme of stars and guidance as Magical Mirai hits new heights.

name: Magical Mirai 2020 (Marching Band)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2020. Mirroring a band leader’s attire with a bright red marching band uniform and a plume hat. Despite the challenges of 2020, this outfit exudes determination and unity through music.

name: Magical Mirai 2021 (Future Lab)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2021. Miku dons a sleek white and teal outfit resembling a science lab coat fused with futuristic fashion. Goggles and techy patterns accent the design, capturing the forward-looking spirit of that year’s event.

name: Magical Mirai 2022 (10th Anniv. Pastel)
description: Miku’s signature outfit from Magical Mirai 2022. For Magical Mirai’s 10th anniversary, Miku wears a soft pastel-colored ensemble that incorporates elements from past years’ designs. It’s a celebratory, all-star outfit – pastel rainbow dress, anniversary logo, and joyful nods to her decade of Magical Mirai.

name: Hatsune Miku (Original)
about: The very first and iconic design of Hatsune Miku, introduced in 2007 as Crypton Future Media’s CV01. This cheerful, futuristic appearance set the template for Miku’s style and concept. She embodies the original Vocaloid idol with her trademark enthusiastic persona.
appearance: Vibrant twin teal pigtails, a silver-gray vest with a shining turquoise tie, a pleated skirt, detached arm sleeves, and thigh-high boots—all accentuated with glowing digital accents that highlight her high-tech, modern look.

name: Hatsune Miku V2 (Classic)
about: The classic 2007-era Miku design from the VOCALOID2 engine era. This sleek version emphasizes simplicity and timeless style, reflecting her early career as the definitive virtual pop icon. Fans often refer to this outfit as “Classic Miku.”
appearance: A black-and-teal sleeveless vest paired with a short pleated skirt in the same color scheme, a bright turquoise tie, fingerless arm warmers, and black knee-high boots. Her twin tails remain vibrant teal, completing the memorable look.

name: Hatsune Miku Append
about: An ethereal variant representing Miku’s Vocaloid2 vocal extension called "Append". Released in 2010, Append Miku has a softer, more elegant vibe with a hint of glow. She adds a new dimension of expressiveness and maturity to Miku’s character.
appearance: A translucent white-and-black outfit with glowing cyan accents all over. She has a bare midriff and sheer flowing sleeves. Her long teal hair seems luminescent, enhancing the magical, otherworldly aura of the design.

name: Sakura Miku (Cherries)
about: A springtime variant of Miku celebrating cherry blossoms, introduced in 2012. This cheerful outfit captures the essence of spring with floral motifs, representing renewal and sunshine in Miku’s world. It’s one of the most beloved seasonal variants among fans.
appearance: Soft pink twin-tails tied with cherry motifs, a pale pink variation of her classic outfit decorated with flower and cherry blossom patterns. Her design exudes a joyful, summery charm with delicate floral accents and matching pink boots.

name: Sakura Miku (Blossom Ponytails)
about: An extra-floral, limited edition of Sakura Miku for true spring enthusiasts. This variant keeps the cherry blossom theme but amplifies it with flowing hair and additional floral details, making it one of the more ornate cherry blossom designs.
appearance: Long, flowing petal-pink twin-tails featuring subtle white blossom patterns, and a pink sailor-style uniform with decorative ribbons, ribbons and flowers at the shoulders. Her outfit has a festive, flowery flair with a springtime vibe.

name: Easter Bunny Miku
about: A seasonal springtime Miku in an adorable Easter bunny costume, bringing pastel charm and fun to her lineup. Debuted around Easter time, this costume is known for its cute and innocent styling, perfect for the holiday season.
appearance: White and pastel-colored dress with bunny ears and a fluffy tail. She often carries a basket of decorated eggs. The outfit includes ribbons and bows, and her boots and accessories match the soft spring palette of pinks, blues, and yellows.

name: Seifuku Miku (Sailor School Uniform)
about: A classic Japanese schoolgirl Miku in a navy-blue sailor uniform. This youthful variant emphasizes innocence and everyday charm, often seen as a tribute to Japanese school culture. It highlights Miku’s versatility beyond futuristic outfits.
appearance: Navy-blue pleated skirt with a matching sailor-collared white blouse. Two teal ribbons tie her hair into twin tails, echoing the uniform’s style. She wears simple shoes and the overall look is clean, sweet, and reminiscent of youth.

name: Deep-Sea Girl Miku
about: An ethereal variant inspired by the song "深海少女" (Deep-Sea Girl) by Yuuyu-P. This mysterious costume portrays Miku as an undersea princess, capturing a dreamy yet haunting atmosphere of the ocean’s depths.
appearance: Long flowing deep-blue mermaid-like dress with layered ruffles resembling waves. Her hair drifts as if underwater, and delicate, frilled accents on her arms and dress mimic sea creatures. The colors range from sapphire to black to reflect ocean currents.

name: Black Rock Shooter
about: Miku channeling Black★Rock Shooter, a dark alternate persona originally from illustrator Huke’s creation. This crossover design fuses Miku with the intense, rock-inspired style of the Black Rock Shooter character, giving her a fiercer edge.
appearance: A long black coat draped over a black combat outfit (short top and shorts), with a single blazing blue eye (like BRS), and dynamic black thigh-high boots. The stance is aggressive and ready-to-fight, markedly different from Miku’s usual sweetness.

name: Hachune Miku
about: The chibi, meme-inspired Miku known for her wide grin and ever-present green onion (negi). Based on a dodolfin figure and popular illustrations, Hachune Miku is more of a cute mascot form than a serious variant, beloved for her humor.
appearance: A tiny, simplified Miku head with a big smile and stubby teal twin-tails on top of a pair of human legs in white stockings and pink shoes. She constantly waves a green leek in one hand. The design is intentionally comedic and adorable.

name: Miku (China Version)
about: An officially-inspired Chinese-themed outfit for Hatsune Miku, reflecting traditional Chinese culture. This elegant costume was introduced alongside her Mandarin vocal release (VOCALOID4 Chinese), celebrating her reach into new cultures.
appearance: A flowing white silk dress with red floral motifs (like a cheongsam), wide decorative sleeves, and gold trim accents. She often wears matching hair ornaments and patterns inspired by Chinese art. The color palette is white, red, and gold, signifying elegance and festivity.

name: The Intense Voice of Hatsune Miku (Gekishou)
about: A gothic, vampire-like variant created for the song "Gekishou" (The Intense Voice). This design emphasizes drama and intensity, reflecting the dark theme of the track and showcasing Miku’s ability to embody even sinister styles.
appearance: A frilled black-and-red Gothic dress with a high collar and lace accents. Dramatic billowy sleeves and a layered skirt create a powerful silhouette. Black lace gloves and red highlights (like ribbons) add to the vampiric, intense aura of this outfit.

name: World Is Mine Miku
about: A regal, princess-inspired variant from the famous song “The World Is Mine.” Miku dons a spoilt, diva-like persona in this outfit, reflecting the music video’s theme of being a pampered pop idol who declares herself the world’s greatest diva.
appearance: A frilly black princess dress decorated with bright red roses. She wears a small crown on her head and long gloves. Her expression and pose convey a spoiled-but-cute attitude. The black and red color scheme and royal elements give a dramatic, diva look.

name: Rolling Girl Miku
about: A troubled, punkish schoolgirl look from the song “Rolling Girl,” portraying Miku in a darker, more rebellious mood. This outfit highlights the theme of struggle and emotional weight from the song.
appearance: A tattered school uniform in muted tones (grays and blacks), with bandages wrapped around her arms. Her twin tails are messy, and she has a melancholic or distressed expression. The worn-out, desaturated style underscores a sense of fatigue or sadness.

name: Ghost Rule Miku
about: An edgy punk-rock outfit inspired by the song "Ghost Rule". Miku adopts a darker, rebellious image with this design, emphasizing raw emotion and a bit of anarchy, in line with the song’s intense, confessional lyrics.
appearance: A black and red layered outfit with ripped layers and asymmetrical cuts. She wears thigh-high boots and fingerless gloves. Her expression is secretive or defiant. The color scheme of black and deep red, along with the torn style, conveys a strong, punk attitude.

name: Yowane Haku
about: A fan-made derivative character often considered Miku’s sleepy, melancholic sister. Known as "Yowane Haku," this outfit portrays an exhausted, silver-haired idol who never quite made it big, embodying themes of fatigue and wistfulness.
appearance: Long silver-gray ponytail tied with a red ribbon. She wears a pale gray-and-purple uniform that looks casual and a bit tired, with her expression always looking tired or sad. Her red eyes and simple outfit give a sense of unfulfilled dreams.

name: Nurse Miku (Love-Colored Ward)
about: A playful nurse-themed outfit based on the song "Love-Colored Ward" (Koishiki Byoutou). This variant plays on medical motifs with a cute twist, reflecting the song’s romantic yet whimsical hospital setting.
appearance: A white nurse’s dress and cap with pink cross motifs, trimmed in pink. She also wears a pink apron and heart-shaped accents on her outfit and accessories. The overall look is cute and caregiving, combining medical and romantic imagery.

name: Senbonzakura Miku
about: A patriotic Taishō-era military uniform inspired by the iconic song "Senbonzakura" by Kurousa-P. This outfit combines historical Japanese military dress with cherry blossom symbolism for a dramatic, nationalistic feel.
appearance: A deep magenta military-style jacket decorated with cherry blossom emblems, paired with a matching officer’s cap. She wears white gloves and boots, and the ensemble is accented with gold trimmings. The fusion of officer uniform and sakura motifs is striking.

name: Saihate Miku (The farthest end)
about: A somber, elegiac outfit from the song "Saihate". This version of Miku is dressed in mourning attire, reflecting the song’s themes of longing and sadness. It’s one of her most graceful yet melancholic looks.
appearance: A long, modest black lace dress with intricate detail, complete with a veil. Her look is very gothic and Victorian-inspired, giving her a graceful but mournful appearance. The all-black ensemble exudes a quietly dramatic elegance.

name: Sand Planet (Suna no Wakusei) Miku
about: A rugged, post-apocalyptic outfit inspired by the song "Sand Planet" (Suna no Wakusei) by Hachi (Kenshi Yonezu). Miku appears as a desert survivor, reflecting the song’s theme of a dying Earth under the sun.
appearance: A tattered earth-toned cloak and loose pants for desert travel, paired with sturdy boots. She wears a wide-brimmed hat for sun protection, and a gas mask hangs around her neck. The look is practical and worn, befitting a harsh desert world.

name: Alien Alien Miku
about: A whimsical, neon-colored outfit for the song "Alien Alien" by NayutalieN. This extraterrestrial theme costume matches the song’s futuristic vibe, depicting Miku as a fun-loving space alien.
appearance: A bright neon-green and purple mini dress with futuristic patterns. She has antenna-like accessories on her twin tails and striped thigh-high stockings. The whole look is playful and otherworldly, with sharp, eye-catching neon colors.

name: Dark Angel (Secret Police)
about: A gothic lolita style Miku also known as "Dark Angel" from Project DIVA Arcade F (Secret Police mode). This look casts her as an angelic figure gone dark, blending innocence with a rebellious edge.
appearance: A frilly black lace dress with multiple layers, small black wings on her back, and a subtle dark halo. She completes the look with knee-high black boots. The contrast of angelic elements (wings, halo) with the dark palette creates a unique gothic charm.

name: March Hare Miku
about: A playful Wonderland-themed costume where Miku portrays the March Hare. Inspired by Alice in Wonderland aesthetics, this design is whimsical and colorful, embodying the zany tea party spirit.
appearance: Pastel blue bunny ears headband and fluffy tail, a frilly white apron over a pink and blue dress with clock and teacup motifs. She wears striped stockings and oversized bow details, giving a fun and energetic vibe like a mad tea party host.

name: Lollipop Miku
about: A candy-pop inspired outfit from Project DIVA X, showcasing Miku in a sugar-sweet theme. This cheerful costume makes her look like a walking piece of candy, capturing a fun, colorful side of her personality.
appearance: Candy-pink frilly lolita dress with large bows and lollipop accessories. She holds a giant spiral lollipop and wears matching striped stockings and ribboned shoes. The pastel palette and candy motifs emphasize an adorable, youthful style.

name: Maneki Miku (Lucky Cat)
about: A traditional festive costume celebrating Japanese luck, with Miku dressed as a maneki-neko (beckoning cat). This outfit is associated with good fortune and is often seen in New Year’s collections, merging culture with idol fashion.
appearance: A red-and-white kimono-style dress with cat-ear headband and a golden bell collar. She poses with a raised paw gesture. The look is completed with a raised paw and a cheerful grin, symbolizing fortune and a playful cat motif.

name: Miku Symphony 2017 (Ball Gown)
about: An elegant concert-themed outfit worn by Miku for the 2017 Symphony concert. It emphasizes classical music motifs, presenting her as a refined virtuoso on stage.
appearance: A sophisticated floor-length black ball gown with blue lining accents, reminiscent of a formal concerto attire. She holds a violin and wears white opera gloves. The regal gown contrasts with her bright teal hair, merging elegance and iconography.

name: Miku Symphony 2018 (Maid)
about: A demure, classical outfit themed for the 2018 Symphony concert. This maid-like costume blends grace with cuteness, symbolizing Miku’s versatility in adopting traditional styles for a modern concert.
appearance: A black-and-white frilled dress with a lace apron and a musical note brooch, resembling a refined maid uniform. The outfit is detailed with white lace and pleats, and she accessorizes with a delicate headpiece. It has a vintage elegance suited for orchestral ambiance.

name: Miku Symphony 2020 (5th Anniversary)
about: A princess-like ceremonial gown for the 5th anniversary of the Miku Symphony. This celebratory outfit is elaborate and ornate, befitting a landmark anniversary concert.
appearance: A long white ball gown with sky-blue lining, covered in musical note motifs. She holds a conductor’s baton and wears a glittering pattern of musical notes on the dress. The multi-layered skirt and sparkling accents create a majestic and celebratory look.

name: Hatsune Miku if ver.
about: A concept art outfit imagining Miku in a school-uniform-inspired design (“if” version). This alternate look came from official illustration, showing a more casual and inquisitive side of Miku.
appearance: A white dress with teal accents resembling a school uniform, with a slightly brownish teal hair color. The outfit is simple yet charming, capturing a youthful, inquisitive expression and a small curious smile.

name: Hatsune Miku: Winter Live
about: A cozy, festive outfit designed for a winter concert. This warm costume is ideal for cold-weather events and embraces the winter season with a cheerful style.
appearance: A white winter coat adorned with blue snowflake patterns, a fluffy blue-and-white scarf, earmuffs, and gloves. Her hair has fluffy accents, and she wears warm boots. The entire look is bundled and snug, reflecting a winter festival mood.

name: Birthday Miku (2019 Blue)
about: A party-themed outfit Miku wore for her birthday celebration (blue version 2019). It’s a cheerful, festive look created to celebrate Hatsune Miku’s anniversary with fans.
appearance: A sky-blue tiered party dress with lots of ruffles, ribbons, and bows. She carries a decorated birthday cake with lit candles. The color is bright and cheerful, with bows in her twin tails and a festive, birthday atmosphere.

name: Bottle Miku
about: A whimsical variant depicting a miniaturized Miku living inside a glass bottle like a genie. Inspired by creative fan art, this outfit is playful and imaginative, turning Miku into a tiny bottled character.
appearance: A tiny blue-haired Miku sealed inside a clear glass bottle. Her long hair floats upwards as if liquid, and the bottle is corked at the top. The design makes her look delicate and magical, as if she’s a genie in a bottle.

name: Shiteyan’yo (Legs Miku)
about: A bizarre and humorous variant based on the internet meme “Shiteyan’yo,” which features Miku’s head atop a pair of human legs. This odd design is a viral comedic character rather than an official outfit.
appearance: A bright pink Miku head with a huge grin, stuck onto a pair of human legs wearing white thigh-high stockings and pink shoes. The incongruous, meme-inspired look is intentionally absurd and cute in a ridiculous way.

name: Love Is War Miku
about: A rebellious outfit from the intense song "Love Is War" by ryo. This costume portrays Miku with a darker, more aggressive style, reflecting the song’s themes of forbidden romance and conflict.
appearance: A tattered black dress with ripped sleeves and scarf, fingerless gloves, and thigh-high boots. The scarf and dress swirl around her, and the colors are stark (mainly black) to emphasize the edgy, almost punk vibe of the design.

name: Sweet Pumpkin Miku
about: A festive Halloween-themed Miku, often referred to as Sweet Pumpkin. This cute witch outfit is full of autumn and Halloween motifs, and was used in seasonal promotions.
appearance: An orange-and-purple witch dress adorned with pumpkin motifs and striped stockings. She wears a pointed witch hat and holds a jack-o’-lantern staff. The look is playful and colorful, capturing the fun side of Halloween.

name: Snow Miku 2011 (Fluffy Coat)
about: The first official Snow Miku costume from 2011, debuting the winter collaboration in Sapporo’s snow festival. It set the foundation for annual winter Miku designs and is characterized by its very cozy look.
appearance: A plush white winter coat with pink trim, complete with matching earmuffs and a fluffy scarf. The outfit is heavy and warm-looking, evoking a sweet snowy aesthetic with soft textures and pastel accents.

name: Snow Miku 2012 (Scarf)
about: Snow Miku’s 2012 design features her bundled up in a light blue winter coat with a large fluffy hood. This year’s outfit is cozy and highlights the celebration of snow with simple elegance.
appearance: A light-blue winter coat with white fur trim and pom-pom hood ties, paired with a big fluffy hood. She has silver-white hair, and snowflake patterns appear on her outfit and accessories, emphasizing the winter theme.

name: Snow Miku 2013 (Strawberry White Kimono)
about: Snow Miku 2013 is dressed in an elegant white kimono patterned with strawberries. This outfit combines traditional Japanese dress with winter and fruit motifs, resulting from a fan contest design.
appearance: A pure white kimono decorated with pink strawberry and floral designs. She wears a pink obi (belt) and matching hair accessories. The look is delicate and graceful, and the bright strawberries add a cheerful contrast.

name: Snow Miku 2014 (Magical Snow)
about: Snow Miku 2014 transforms into a magical sorceress of winter. This design, involving a wizard-like ensemble, emphasizes snow and stars in a fantasy interpretation of the Snow Miku theme.
appearance: A white cape and wizard hat decorated with stars and snowflake motifs, over a pale blue dress. She holds an icy snowflake staff, and there are sparkling accents on the outfit. The overall look is that of a wintertime magician or fairy.

name: Snow Miku 2015 (Snow Bell)
about: Snow Miku 2015’s theme is 'Snow Bell,' featuring a bell-shaped dress with lily-of-the-valley motifs. This design is one of the most elaborate, evoking the idea of Miku as a gentle winter spirit among flowers.
appearance: A white bell-shaped dress with green ribbon accents and fur trim at the hem. It is decorated with delicate lily-of-the-valley flower motifs. She has snow-white hair and tiny winter bells as accessories. The color scheme is mainly white and pastel green.

name: Snow Miku 2016 (Snow Owl Parka)
about: Snow Miku 2016 is dressed in a cozy winter parka with an owl motif, reflecting winter sports and the Night in Sapporo. The design includes a playful owl detail, symbolizing winter wildlife.
appearance: A blue-and-white winter parka with pink accents and a snow owl motif. She wears ski goggles on her head, white leggings, and boots. The parka is puffy, and there’s an owl illustration on it. Overall she looks dressed for fun in the snow.

name: Snow Miku 2017 (Twinkle Constellations)
about: Snow Miku 2017 wears a cosmic night-sky theme. The outfit incorporates stars and constellations, as if Miku herself is part of the winter night sky, celebrating the beauty of Hokkaido’s winter heavens.
appearance: A midnight-blue cloak with patterns of constellations, over a shimmering silver-blue dress with star-shaped accessories. Her hair is adorned with little silver stars, and she holds a star wand. The ensemble sparkles like a winter constellation.

name: Snow Miku 2018 (Crane Priestess)
about: Snow Miku 2018 is themed as a graceful crane-inspired shrine maiden. The design emphasizes traditional imagery of cranes, signifying longevity and grace in Japanese culture, set against winter backdrops.
appearance: She wears a white haori (jacket) and a red hakama (skirt) like a Shinto priestess. The outfit is decorated with crane-feather patterns, and she has crane-tail hair ornaments. The look is elegant and spiritual, with a soft white and red color scheme.

name: Snow Miku 2019 (Princess)
about: Snow Miku 2019 portrays her as an ice princess. The design is regal and frosty, befitting a winter queen theme, celebrating the elegance of snow.
appearance: A flowing ice-blue multi-layered ball gown, adorned with delicate snowflake ornaments. She wears a sparkling tiara and has crystal-like hair accessories. The look is majestic and icy, all in cool blues and whites.

name: Snow Miku 2020 (Marching Orchestra)
about: Snow Miku 2020 wears a festive parade uniform to lead a winter band. The theme blends music and winter celebration, reflecting a grand, marching-band aesthetic.
appearance: A white military-style jacket with gold trim, paired with a navy pleated skirt and tall boots. She wears a tall peaked hat with a navy plume. Musical note decorations accent the outfit, and she looks like a drum major in white and blue.

name: Snow Miku 2021 (Illumination)
about: Snow Miku 2021 is themed around winter illumination. Her outfit is bright and decorated with lightbulb patterns, capturing the festive spirit of winter lights.
appearance: A white parka with multi-colored lightbulb prints, over a midnight-blue skirt. She carries a lightbulb staff and has twinkling bulb accessories. Multicolored bulbs adorn her hood and scarf, making her appear like a walking light display.

name: Snow Miku 2022 (Hokkaido Sea)
about: Snow Miku 2022’s theme is the sea. She wears an ocean-inspired winter outfit, symbolizing Hokkaido’s relationship with the sea and nature even in winter.
appearance: A flowing ocean-blue dress with pearl and shell accessories, and wave-like transparent sleeves. Pearl and shell motifs decorate her outfit, and the colors are various shades of blue. She has a calm, serene presence like the winter sea.

name: Rin Style (Miku as Rin)
about: A crossover where Miku cosplays as Kagamine Rin, sporting Rin’s signature yellow-and-black outfit. This playful variant shows Miku in another Vocaloid’s iconic outfit, celebrating the camaraderie among the characters.
appearance: A yellow-and-black sailor top with a matching pleated skirt and Rin’s big yellow hair bow. Miku’s hair is styled in a short blonde ponytail to match Rin’s look, and she wears white boots. The outfit is bright and energetic, just like Rin’s.

name: Len Style (Miku as Len)
about: Miku dressed as Kagamine Len, adopting his signature sailor-style outfit. This fun variant highlights Miku taking on Len’s persona, complete with Len’s color scheme, for a gender-bent cosplay effect.
appearance: A white sailor shirt with a blue necktie and black shorts with yellow accents, mimicking Len’s style. She sports a short ponytail and wears white boots. The outfit has playful, masculine-cut lines, making Miku look like Len himself.

name: Luka Style (Miku as Luka)
about: A cosplay version where Miku wears Megurine Luka’s elegant outfit. By adopting Luka’s attire, Miku experiments with a more mature, graceful look, bridging the styles of two popular Vocaloid divas.
appearance: A black and gold midriff-baring dress with a high slit, matching Luka’s design. Miku wears pink wavy twin-tail wigs to mimic Luka’s hair and white boots. The outfit is seductive and elegant, reflecting Luka’s style.

name: MEIKO Style (Miku as MEIKO)
about: Miku dressed in the classic red outfit of Vocaloid MEIKO. This nostalgic crossover shows Miku in MEIKO’s iconic early costume, paying homage to one of the first characters in Crypton’s Vocaloid series.
appearance: A red sleeveless crop top and matching red skirt, with black boots, identical to MEIKO’s classic outfit. Miku sports straight brown hair in pigtails to resemble MEIKO’s look. The bold red color scheme is a direct tribute to MEIKO’s early design.

name: KAITO Style (Miku as KAITO)
about: Miku cosplays as KAITO, wearing his classic blue coat and scarf. This playful gender-swap tribute showcases Miku in KAITO’s signature warm ensemble, blending her features with his laid-back style.
appearance: A long bright blue coat with white accents and a matching long blue scarf, just like KAITO’s outfit. Miku has black pants and white boots, and she dons a short blue wig or similar styling. The confident, cool color scheme mimics KAITO’s look.

name: Teto Style (Miku as Teto)
about: Miku dressed as Kasane Teto (a utauloid who is a well-known unofficial Vocaloid). She adopts Teto’s lively, rockabilly-inspired outfit, complete with Teto’s signature pink twin-drill hairstyle.
appearance: A red and white gothic lolita dress with ribbons, matching Teto’s style. Miku wears pink twin-drill hair attachments to mimic Teto’s drills, and black boots. The look is energetic and playful, reflecting Teto’s cheerful personality.

name: GUMI Style (Miku as GUMI)
about: Miku wearing GUMI’s signature outfit. This crossover shows Miku adopting GUMI’s colorful, futuristic style, complete with large orange goggles and a cheerful expression, highlighting their friendship among Crypton’s vocaloids.
appearance: An orange cropped jacket and green skirt with black trim, identical to GUMI’s costume. She also wears green-tinted goggles on her head. The outfit is bright and vibrant, capturing GUMI’s pop idol vibe.

name: Hatsune Miku 10th Anniversary (Pearl Ver.)
about: A pearlescent commemorative outfit celebrating Hatsune Miku’s 10th anniversary. This design is festive and elegant, marking a decade of Miku’s influence with a mature, glitzy style.
appearance: A shiny white ball gown adorned with rainbow-colored ribbons and a glittering "10" emblem. The dress has elegant frills and a sophisticated silhouette. Miku’s hair is styled with long flowing twin tails, and the outfit overall sparkles like a celebration.

name: Fairy Miku (3rd Spring)
about: A whimsical fairy-themed outfit from the 3rd Spring collection. This costume portrays Miku as a nature fairy surrounded by spring blooms, emphasizing a delicate and playful side of her.
appearance: A light green dress with petal-like layers and butterfly-wing accents on her back. She has flower petal hair accessories and carries a playful, mischievous expression. The outfit is very spring-like, with pastel greens and floral motifs.

name: Hatsune Miku: Heart×Ribbon
about: A sweet, romantic idol outfit adorned with heart motifs. This costume is meant to evoke feelings of love and cuteness, fitting for an affectionate theme song or Valentine’s event.
appearance: A frilly pink dress decorated with heart shapes and ribbons. She wears matching heart-shaped hair ornaments and boots. The entire look is soft pink with white trims, giving a girlish, idol-like charm.

name: Harvest Moon Miku
about: An autumn-themed Miku dressed for a harvest festival. The costume draws on traditional Japanese fall imagery, blending a warm, rustic palette with motifs of moon and rabbits (common in moon-viewing festivals).
appearance: A brown and orange kimono adorned with moon and rabbit motifs, tied with a red obi belt. The outfit includes golden leaf patterns scattered in the design. The colors and symbols reflect autumn and the harvest moon theme.

name: Leo/need Miku
about: A casual, band-inspired outfit from Project SEKAI’s Leo/need unit. It shows Miku as a member of a school band, reflecting her versatility and appeal in rhythm games.
appearance: A light school uniform featuring a cardigan and skirt, combined with trendy sneakers. She carries a guitar, indicating her rock musician style. The outfit is laid-back with an instrument strap over her shoulder, fitting the Leo/need band aesthetic.

name: MiCrystal (Crystal Miku)
about: A sparkling, gem-like version of Miku, as if she were made of crystal. Inspired by the Project DIVA song “Crystal,” this outfit gives Miku a translucent, jewel-toned appearance.
appearance: A translucent outfit and hair that look faceted like crystals, refracting light into rainbow colors. Her dress and accessories have gem-like edges. The whole ensemble has a clear, shining quality, with iridescent blues and pinks.

name: Odds and Ends Miku
about: A humble, mechanic-inspired outfit from the song "ODDS & ENDS" by ryo. This variant shows Miku as an everyday worker, emphasizing simplicity and sincerity, much like the tone of the song.
appearance: A white tank top and blue work overalls (or jeans) with sturdy boots. She wears brown work gloves and has tools around her belt or in her hands. The look is practical and down-to-earth, highlighting a hardworking, modest character.

name: Rabbit Hole Miku
about: An Alice-in-Wonderland-inspired outfit from the Project Diva song "Alice in Wonderland - Derivatives". This design features Miku embarking on a curious adventure, reflecting the whimsical and curious nature of Alice.
appearance: A blue and white checkered dress with a white apron, reminiscent of Alice’s classic dress. She wears striped stockings and carries a pocket watch or tea party accessory. The look is curious and cute, blending wonderland elements into Miku’s style.

name: Romeo and Cinderella Miku
about: A fairy-tale ball gown inspired by the song "Romeo and Cinderella". This outfit channels the elegance and romance of a storybook heroine attending a royal ball.
appearance: A long, flowing white and deep-blue lace gown with puffed sleeves and intricate designs. She wears long gloves and has elegant braided hair. The dress is ornate with lace and ribbons, exuding a gentle, romantic fairy-tale vibe.

name: Miku (Winter Image)
about: A cozy winter illustration outfit often used in fan art and seasonal scenes. This generic winter style emphasizes warmth and comfort, embodying the spirit of wintertime festivities with Miku in a soft, layered outfit.
appearance: She wears a thick fur-lined coat, warm scarf, earmuffs and mittens. The colors are usually cool winter hues, and the outfit is functional for snow. Snow often softly falls around her in images, conveying a peaceful winter atmosphere.

name: Tell Your World Miku
about: A colorful street-fashion outfit from the “Tell Your World” Google Chrome campaign. This design is vibrant and modern, highlighting Miku’s connection to digital and real worlds with its arty, layered look.
appearance: A rainbow-splattered tutu skirt with multicolored layers, paired with a sleeveless hoodie and large headphones around her neck. The top is usually black or dark, with paint splashes, and the tutu is bright. The look is very urban and creative.

name: Sakura no Ame Miku (Cherry-Petal Uniform)
about: A sentimental cherry-blossom school uniform variant from the song “Sakura no Ame.” It reflects nostalgia and the fleeting beauty of spring, with a gentle schoolgirl theme.
appearance: A pink school uniform blazer and skirt, accented with a red ribbon tie. There are sakura blossom patterns on the outfit, and falling cherry petals may appear around her. The style is reminiscent of a spring school scene with soft pink tones.

name: Zatsune Miku
about: Miku’s infamous darker alter-ego, created by fans. Zatsune has a sinister vibe and is known for her edgy songs. This costume was used in some rhythm games to represent the evil side of Miku.
appearance: Long black twin-tails with red highlights, red eyes, and a black and red variation of Miku’s outfit (similar cut but dark). The colors are inverted from her normal style, giving an intense, sinister look.

name: Magical Mirai 2013 (Magician Top-Hat)
about: A theatrical magician’s outfit worn by Miku at the first Magical Mirai 2013 concert. It gives her a showman’s flair, highlighting her as a stage performer for the opening of this annual series.
appearance: A black top hat and cape draped over a red bow tie and white gloves. She wears a formal black tailcoat-style jacket and black boots. The ensemble is that of a classic magician, complete with wand (not pictured) and stage presence.

name: Magical Mirai 2014 (Future Ribbon)
about: An ultramodern outfit from Magical Mirai 2014, featuring a futuristic design and an oversized teal hair ribbon (the event motif). It represents Miku’s role as a forward-looking virtual idol.
appearance: A white-and-silver futuristic mini dress with neon accents, and an extra-large teal bow in her hair. She wears techy sunglasses as a visor and neon embellishments. The look is sleek, sci-fi inspired, with metallic fabrics.

name: Magical Mirai 2015 (Plaid Crown)
about: A stylish plaid ensemble with a regal twist from Magical Mirai 2015. Miku looks like a pop princess at a concert, combining modern fashion with royal imagery for a dynamic stage presence.
appearance: A vest and skirt made of vibrant plaid fabric, paired with a white blouse. She has a small gold crown headpiece. The colors are bright (reds, yellows, greens), and the outfit is accessorized like school tartan patterns with the elegance of a crown.

name: Magical Mirai 2016 (Blue Parade)
about: A marching band-themed outfit in royal blue, introduced at Magical Mirai 2016. It presents Miku as the leader of a parade, matching the concert’s theme of celebration and energy.
appearance: A royal blue military-style jacket with gold trim, white pants, and tall boots. She wears a blue hat with a long plume. The uniform looks like a drum major’s outfit, blending music and parade imagery.

name: Magical Mirai 2017 (Sailor Lab)
about: A unique fusion costume from Magical Mirai 2017, combining a school sailor uniform with a lab coat. It reflects the event’s playful theme of mixing scholarly and scientific elements.
appearance: A white sailor-collared blouse merged with a light blue lab coat, and a navy pleated skirt. She has lab goggles resting on her head. The outfit looks scholarly-cute, balancing a student uniform and scientist’s lab attire.

name: Magical Mirai 2018 (Harlequin Circus)
about: A playful circus-themed costume from Magical Mirai 2018. This outfit embraces a jester/harlequin motif, highlighting Miku’s fun and whimsical side as a performer in a carnival-like setting.
appearance: A dress covered in blue and purple diamond (harlequin) patterns, with a jester-style collar. She wears a colorful top hat with ribbons and has colorful accessories like a feather or balloon. The costume is festive, like a circus performer’s outfit.

name: Magical Mirai 2019 (Star Crown)
about: A celestial-themed costume from Magical Mirai 2019, featuring star motifs and a glowing crown. It portrays Miku as a star princess, fitting for a grand anniversary event.
appearance: An elegant navy dress patterned with golden stars, paired with a shining star-shaped crown. She has star accessories in her hair and on her gown. The ensemble is dark and regal, evoking a night sky full of stars.

name: Magical Mirai 2020 (Marching Band)
about: A bright red marching band uniform for Magical Mirai 2020. This outfit is energetic and bold, fitting for Miku leading a parade with music and lights.
appearance: A scarlet military-style jacket with gold accents, white trousers, black boots, and a tall red plume hat. The look is festive and proud, like a ceremonial uniform of a parade leader. It’s high-contrast with white and red.

name: Magical Mirai 2021 (Future Lab)
about: A sleek, white-and-teal futuristic lab technician outfit from Magical Mirai 2021. It combines science lab motifs with a modern twist, showing Miku as an idol scientist in a high-tech future.
appearance: A white lab-coat style jacket with teal accents and tech details, paired with navy leggings. She wears tech goggles on her head and metallic accessories. The clean, modern design highlights a science-and-technology theme.

name: Magical Mirai 2022 (10th Anniversary Pastel)
about: A pastel-hued celebratory dress for Magical Mirai 2022, marking the event’s 10th anniversary. This ensemble is soft and musical-note themed, symbolizing a decade of Miku’s live performances.
appearance: A soft rainbow pastel dress patterned with musical notes, flowing pink and blue ribbons, and an anniversary badge. The dress is light-colored with a flurry of pastel tones, giving a festive and cheerful atmosphere.

name: Magical Mirai 2023 (HERO)
about: A powerful, futuristic stage outfit introduced at Magical Mirai 2023, reflecting the event’s "Hero" theme. This costume emphasizes strength and forward momentum, matching the concert’s heroic concept.
appearance: A sleek armored bodysuit with metallic cyan and black accents, featuring dynamic straps and high-tech detailing. She wears wrist gauntlets and a high collar. The look is bold and energetic, as if Miku is ready to save the day on stage.

name: Magical Mirai 2024
about: A brand-new outfit for Magical Mirai 2024, themed around the upcoming concert. This futuristic design likely features innovative elements, though full details are unveiled at the event itself.
