appearance: A crisp white and teal ensemble with sleek lines and oversized bow, reflecting the official art by artist tama. She sports a large ribbon-like accessory and tech-inspired visor, blending fashion and futurism.

name: Magical Mirai 2025
about: The anticipated costume for Magical Mirai 2025. Designed by Tiv, it promises another year of creative flair. (Details will be revealed at the 2025 concert.)
appearance: As revealed in promotional art, she dons a glamorous outfit with flowing fabric and musical motifs. The official preview shows her in a stage-ready pose, likely continuing the tradition of combining fashion with music themes.

name: Hatsune Miku The First Dream
about: Based on the cover art of the album "The First Dream" by lamazeP, featuring guest singer Daming. This elegant costume captures the aesthetic of the album, blending futuristic and whimsical elements in a dreamy style.
appearance: A delicate, flowing dress with pastel gradient colors. She has crystal-like accessories and a soft color palette. The design is ethereal, with gentle blues and pinks, reflecting the dreamlike quality of the album artwork.

name: Hatsune Miku Greatest Idol
about: Inspired by the album cover art for "The Greatest Idol" by Mitchie M. This regal outfit is based on Yoshiyuki Sadamoto’s illustration, featuring a crown motif. It reflects the title by portraying Miku as a proud, divalike idol.
appearance: A royal-themed ensemble with white and gold accents. She wears a stylized crown headpiece and a flowing white cape with red lining. The outfit has elegant details and epitomizes an idol queen’s appearance.

name: Hatsune Miku Digital Stars 2022
about: An outfit from the Digital Stars 2022 compilation series. This costume matches the EDM compilation’s futuristic and vibrant style, featuring high-tech flair befitting an electronic music theme.
appearance: A short black and neon blue jacket with glowing LED-like patterns, paired with a sleek mini-skirt and techy boots. She has glowing accessories, and overall the design is modern and dance-ready for the EDM stage.

name: Hatsune Miku Chinese New Year 2023
about: A festive outfit celebrating the Chinese New Year of 2023 (Year of the Rabbit). Incorporating traditional Chinese elements, this costume honors Asian New Year traditions with an idol twist.
appearance: A red and gold cheongsam-inspired dress adorned with floral patterns. The design includes intricate traditional details and maybe a lantern or ribbon motif. The vibrant red color symbolizes luck and prosperity for the new year.

name: Snow Miku 2023 (Serene Winter)
about: Snow Miku 2023’s official theme is “Serene Winter,” featuring a sky/cloud motif. This costume portrays Miku as a graceful figure of the winter sky, with soft pastel colors and a calm expression.
appearance: A soft pink and blue outfit with cloud patterns. She comes with a small figure of Rabbit Yukine (her mascot) and accessories like an umbrella. The design has pastel feathers and evokes a tranquil winter sky.

name: Snow Miku 2024 (Winter Delicacy)
about: Snow Miku 2024’s theme is "Winter Delicacy", celebrating Hokkaido’s winter food. This outfit is based on the winning design by shiro featuring soup curry motifs, blending culinary and winter imagery.
appearance: A dress and coat with soup curry and wheat motifs in warm cream and brown tones, reflecting local winter cuisine. She has a chef’s touch with mittens shaped like bowls, and the outfit looks like winter attire mixed with food-themed accessories.

name: Hatsune Miku: Little Missing Stars
about: "Little Missing Stars" is an outfit based on the recent song of the same name by sasanomaly & Nekobo-ro. The design brings the song’s gentle, candy-colored aesthetic to Miku’s wardrobe.
appearance: A sugary pastel pink dress with star and bow motifs, capturing a dreamy atmosphere. She holds pastel props and the outfit is softly layered with gentle frills, reflecting the cute, light-hearted tone of the song.

name: Racing Miku 2017
about: A motorsport-inspired outfit from Good Smile Racing’s 2017 design. Known as Racing Miku 2017, this version reflects the year’s racing theme, mixing performance wear with futuristic styling.
appearance: A bold ensemble with racing suit elements in blue, white and yellow. She wears form-fitting pants and a sporty top with sponsor logos, and metallic gauntlets. The outfit is aerodynamic and professional, like a race queen.

name: Racing Miku 2021 Private Ver.
about: An exclusive alternate Racing Miku design for 2021. The "Private Ver." is a special edition with a unique color scheme, meant to celebrate Good Smile Racing’s activities that year.
appearance: A sleek outfit similar to the standard racing suit, but with a distinctive white and cyan color palette. She has additional embellishments and covers (like a cape), making it look more ceremonial. The design is elegant yet sporty.

name: Hatsune Miku Expo 2024 Ver.
about: A sharp, modern look designed for the Hatsune Miku Expo 2024 tour. It emphasizes a global theme, combining futuristic and stage-worthy elements as Miku travels worldwide.
appearance: A black-and-white stylized bodysuit with glowing cyan highlights. She wears a long flowing coat with digital patterns and lighting elements. The design is sleek and international, reflecting the expo’s high-tech presentation.

name: Purple Girl Miku
about: An official design by Shino for the "Purple Girl" series, featuring Miku in a soft lavender, gauzy outfit. This variant appeared on merchandise and statues, giving Miku a dreamy, ethereal appearance.
appearance: She wears a white layered dress with wide sleeves and a translucent purple cape. Her hair is tinted lavender. The overall palette is pale purple and white, and the look is airy and otherworldly, like a gentle spring goddess.

name: Magical Mirai 2026 Teaser
about: A preview image from Magical Mirai 2026, showing Miku with new outfit elements. (As 2026 hasn’t occurred yet, full details are sparse, but the teaser hints at her continuing futuristic style.)
appearance: The teaser art (if available) shows Miku with novel accessories, likely similar to past themed outfits. The color scheme is not fully revealed, but it suggests another creative directional change for Miku’s look.

name: Snow Miku 2025
about: Snow Miku 2025 is the fifteenth anniversary design. Theme and details were chosen by fan vote. It likely features a new winter motif continuing the Snow Miku tradition.
appearance: The official theme is still pending, but teaser hints include a plaid motif or local Hokkaido inspiration. Expect a white-blue color scheme with unique winter elements for 2025.

name: Miku Expo 2022 - Rewind Ver.
about: A special outfit introduced for the "MIKU EXPO 2022 - Rewind" virtual concert. It’s sleek and modern, representing Miku’s virtual world concert branding.
appearance: A sophisticated black and cyan ensemble with a high-tech stage vibe. She has a short coat or jacket with neon trims and tight pants. The design is minimalist but clearly inspired by digital concert visuals.

name: Magical Mirai 10th Anniversary (2015 Plait)
about: A costume for the 10th anniversary of Magical Mirai (celebrated in 2022 as Sapporo event). It features a themed design different from the event stage dress, focusing on the milestone.
appearance: A silver/grey costume with technology motifs, including a jacket and skirt with circuit patterns, celebrating a decade of digital music. The outfit has silver accessories and a commemorative brooch.

name: Warm Wool Miku
about: A cozy winter design created by fans in community events. While not an official variation, it’s popular in art: Miku wrapped in warm knitwear to survive cold winter.
appearance: She wears a large oversized sweater, thick knitted scarf, and a wool hat. The colors are warm (reds, grays), and she might hold a hot drink. The style is homey and casual.

name: Prima Doll Miku
about: A hypothetical or fan-design merging Miku with elements of the anime "Prima Doll". (Not an official outfit; included as a creative crossover concept for fans.)
appearance: She might wear a frilly, Victorian-inspired maid outfit with doll-like accessories. Colors could include blues and whites, with mechanical gears or doll eyes motifs, blending the two franchises.

name: Winter Yukata Miku
about: A fan concept of Miku in a casual yukata for winter, with warm layers. It’s often drawn by fans imagining Miku in traditional wear with winter colors.
appearance: A layered kimono (yukata) with winter patterns like snowflakes, in cool blues. She wears a padded coat over it and hot foot warmers. The ensemble is a blend of yukata elegance and winter practicality.

name: Frostbite Miku
about: A fictional extreme winter battle outfit for Miku, as if she were an ice warrior. This creative idea appears in fan works, equipping Miku for an Arctic adventure.
appearance: Armor made of ice with fur lining, ice-crystal wings, and an icicle staff. Her hair is frosted white at the tips. The outfit glitters like frozen spikes, combining warrior gear with snow motif.

name: Cherry Blossom Maid Miku
about: A fan-designed costume mixing maid aesthetics with cherry blossoms. It’s a spring-themed alternate costume imagining Miku as a cafe maid surrounded by sakura petals.
appearance: A pink and white maid dress with sakura blossom embroidery. She wears a maid headband with blossoms and holds a tray with a blooming branch. The style is cute and elegant, full of floral details.

description_lore: The genesis of a global phenomenon, this is the original Hatsune Miku released for the VOCALOID2 engine on August 31, 2007. Her name translates to 'First Sound of the Future'.[1] Crypton Future Media's official concept was that of an android diva from a future where music had been lost.[2] Crucially, her personality and backstory were left intentionally undefined, establishing her as a blank canvas for creators worldwide to project their own stories and songs onto, a decision that directly sparked the collaborative culture she embodies.[3, 4]
description_appearance: Designed by illustrator KEI, her iconic look features long, turquoise twintails held by futuristic square ribbons. She wears a grey, sleeveless top with a turquoise tie, a black skirt with turquoise trim, and detached black sleeves and thigh-high boots. A digital interface is present on her left sleeve, referencing the Yamaha synthesizers that inspired her design.[1, 5] The number '01' is tattooed in red on her left shoulder, signifying her as the first of Crypton's Character Vocal series.

description_lore: Released in 2010, Miku Append is an expansion library for the VOCALOID2 engine, designed to give the original Miku a greater emotional range. It includes six distinct voicebanks: Soft, Sweet, Dark, Vivid, Solid, and Light.[1] This version represents Miku's evolution from a singular voice into a versatile vocal instrument, allowing producers to craft songs with more nuanced emotional expression, from gentle melancholy to bright cheerfulness.[6, 7]
description_appearance: Designed by Masaki Apsy (Asai Masaki), the Append design is more mature and futuristic. Her outfit is a sleek, form-fitting black and translucent bodysuit with glowing green accents. Her twintails are looser and flow more organically, fading to green at the tips. The overall aesthetic is more ethereal and less rigid than her original design, reflecting the expanded vocal capabilities of the software.[7]

description_lore: This version marks Miku's official debut as a trilingual singer, with the release of her Mandarin Chinese voicebank in 2017 for the VOCALOID4 engine.[1] Known for her 'silvery and cute voice,' this release expanded her creative potential to a massive new audience of producers and fans, solidifying her status as a truly global virtual idol.[8, 9] Her Chinese name is 初音未来 (Chūyīn Wèilái).[1]
description_appearance: Illustrated by mamenomoto, the V4 Chinese design is elegant and incorporates traditional Chinese motifs. She wears a stylish white and grey qipao-inspired top with pink accents, a dark pleated skirt, and flowing, detached sleeves. Her hair is adorned with intricate accessories, and a small red accent mark is visible near her eye. The overall design is a graceful fusion of her futuristic identity and Chinese cultural aesthetics.[9]

description_lore: Hachune Miku is not an official design but a fan-made parody that became one of the most enduring symbols of early Vocaloid culture. She originated from a viral 2007 animation on the Japanese video site Nico Nico Douga, depicting a super-deformed (chibi) Miku endlessly spinning a Welsh onion (often mistaken for a leek) to a cover of the Finnish folk song 'Ievan Polkka'.[10] This meme is the sole reason for the leek/onion becoming Miku's fan-associated character item.
description_appearance: A comically simplified, chibi version of the original Hatsune Miku. Her key features are a vacant, swirling-eyed expression, a perpetually open mouth, and disproportionately large twintails. She is almost always depicted holding a Welsh onion, which she swings with manic energy.

description_lore: Though often mistaken for a Miku variant, Black Rock Shooter is an original character created by illustrator huke. Her association with Miku stems from a massively popular song of the same name composed by ryo (supercell), which used Miku's voicebank.[11, 12] The song's success launched a multimedia franchise, but Crypton Future Media has officially clarified that BRS is a separate character.[11] She is included here due to her deep, inseparable connection to Miku's musical history.
description_appearance: A mysterious girl with black hair in uneven twintails and a blazing blue flame covering her left eye. She wears a black bikini top, shorts, and a long, tattered black coat. Her signature weapon is the '★Rock Cannon,' a massive firearm capable of firing 20 rocks per second.[11, 12] Her design is gritty and battle-worn, a stark contrast to Miku's pop idol aesthetic.

description_lore: Bottle Miku is a popular fan-made derivative (Fanloid) created by Pixiv artist PAR。.[13] This design reimagines Miku in a surreal, aquatic theme. The community-accepted lore portrays her as an ethereal, water-based being whose hair contains living fish, often interpreted as manifestations of her memories or emotions. Her popularity demonstrates the 'fanon-to-canon pipeline' where community creations become widely recognized icons within the fandom.
description_appearance: She wears a white sailor uniform (sailor fuku) with a black collar and crimson trim, paired with a black pleated skirt. Her most distinctive feature is her twintails, which are made of transparent water. Inside her hair swim several red or orange fish, typically goldfish or koi. The twintails are held by black ribbons that match the details of her uniform.[13]

description_lore: This module originates from Yuuyu-P's immensely popular song 'Deep-Sea Girl'.[14] The song's narrative is a metaphor for depression and social anxiety, depicting a girl who has sunk to the bottom of a lonely, dark sea of sadness. She believes she will remain there forever until someone reaches out and shows her warmth and light, helping her to finally surface.[15] The module is the physical embodiment of this sorrowful yet hopeful story.
description_appearance: Based on an illustration by Haruyo, this design features Miku in a beautiful, jet-black dress that contrasts with her pale skin. Her long twintails flow freely as if underwater, fading from turquoise to a deep blue. The dress is adorned with white frills and ribbons, and she is often depicted sitting on a bed of coral, completing the underwater scene.[15]

description_lore: The 'My Dear Bunny' module is a playful and energetic costume from the rhythm game 'Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA Arcade'.[16, 17] It represents a more carefree and charming side of Miku, designed for fun, upbeat songs. The design has become popular enough to be immortalized as a large-scale 1/4th scale figure, a testament to its appeal among fans.[16, 18]
description_appearance: This module features Miku in a stylish black and white bunny suit. The outfit includes a strapless black leotard, a white collar with a black bowtie, white cuffs, and a fluffy white bunny tail. Her look is completed with long black bunny ears, real fabric net tights, and high heels. Her twintails feature an exquisite color gradient.[16, 19]

description_lore: This design captures the essence of spring, reimagining Miku as a delicate and joyful fairy. Based on an illustration by Syugao, this version is part of a series of seasonal figures that celebrate the changing of the seasons.[20] Her lore is simple and evocative: she is a spirit of nature, heralding the arrival of spring with her song and presence.
description_appearance: Miku wears a flowing, layered dress in shades of pink and white, adorned with numerous flowers and bows. Her hair, decorated with a flower tiara, ends in translucent pink tips. The most prominent feature is a pair of large, translucent fairy wings that share the same pink and turquoise gradient as her hair, giving her an ethereal appearance.[20, 21]

description_lore: This elegant Miku is designed in the theme of the Mid-Autumn Festival, a traditional harvest festival celebrated in Chinese culture. The design, by Chinese illustrator Rella, evokes a sense of peace and tranquility, portraying Miku gazing at the full moon.[22] She embodies the serene and beautiful atmosphere of a moonlit autumn night.
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in a beautiful kimono and a light, transparent raiment (a type of shawl or outer garment). The outfit features gentle, pastel colors that create a unique and elegant look. Her twintails are styled into large, soft buns. Optional parts for her Nendoroid figure include a traditional mooncake and a flute, reinforcing the festival theme.[22, 23]

description_lore: A bright and cheerful design featured as a Super Premium prize figure from SEGA.[24] This Miku is all about spreading love and happiness, with a design motif centered on hearts and ribbons. She represents the pure, idol-pop aspect of Miku's persona, posed to entertain her adoring fans.
description_appearance: This outfit is predominantly pink and white. Miku wears a frilly pink and white dress heavily decorated with ribbons and heart patterns. Her twintails are tied with large pink ribbons, and she wears white thigh-high stockings with pink tops. The overall look is incredibly cute and vibrant, fitting for a pop idol performance.[24, 25]

description_lore: This Miku is a fascinating 'what if?' scenario brought to life. Based on an illustration by original character designer KEI, this design explores an alternate reality where a ponytail hairstyle was chosen for Miku instead of her iconic twintails.[26] It's a piece of meta-lore, canonizing a part of Miku's own development history and giving fans a glimpse of the Miku that could have been.
description_appearance: While wearing a very similar futuristic school uniform to the original, this Miku's defining feature is her long, flowing turquoise ponytail. The Nendoroid figure of this version comes with a software box featuring the alternate design, further emphasizing the 'what if' concept.[26, 27]

description_lore: In the world of the mobile rhythm game 'Project SEKAI: COLORFUL STAGE!', Miku exists in different 'SEKAIs,' alternate dimensions born from the true feelings of the game's original characters. For the all-girl band Leo/Need, she appears in the 'School SEKAI'.[28] Here, she acts as a cool, supportive upperclassman, helping the four estranged childhood friends rediscover their bond through music.[29, 30]
description_appearance: Reflecting the band's pop-rock style, Leo/Need Miku has a punk-inspired look. She wears a modified black and white school uniform with plaid accents, a studded belt, and fingerless gloves. Her hair is styled more casually, and she often carries a guitar, ready to jam with the band.

description_lore: A sweet and colorful module from the 'Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA X' game.[31, 32] This design is pure candy-coated fun, embodying a playful and sugary aesthetic. It's designed for cheerful, high-energy pop songs, turning the stage into a vibrant confectionary world.
description_appearance: This outfit is a burst of bright, candy-like colors. Miku wears a frilly dress decorated with patterns resembling lollipops and other sweets. Her hair is adorned with candy-themed accessories, and her overall look is reminiscent of a candy store. The design is often featured on merchandise like trading cards and figures.[31, 33]

description_lore: This iconic module is from the explosive rock anthem 'Love is War' by ryo (supercell).[34, 35] The song's lore depicts love as a battlefield, a desperate and passionate conflict. Miku, acting as a general, shouts her feelings from a precipice, ready to fight for the one she loves. The module's design captures this intense, aggressive, and emotionally charged theme.[36]
description_appearance: Designed by Shirou Miwa, this Miku has a militaristic and edgy look. She wears a dark, modified school uniform with a torn skirt and a red tie. Her most striking features are the giant black horns on her head and the massive megaphones she uses to broadcast her declaration of war. Her expression is fierce and determined.

description_lore: This Miku is designed to bring good fortune to all her fans. The design, by illustrator Tsunako, incorporates elements from the traditional 'maneki-neko' (beckoning cat) figurines, which are believed to bring good luck in Japanese culture.[37, 38, 39] Her lore is that of a charming and adorable harbinger of fortune, ready to bless your home with her presence.
description_appearance: The figure is covered in maneki-neko motifs, including cat ears, a bell collar, and a paw-print pattern on her outfit. She carries a 'senryobako' (a traditional chest for gold coins) that is overflowing with oval gold coins and a golden leek. Her outfit is a stylized kimono in red, white, and gold, completing the lucky cat theme.[38]

description_lore: A whimsical module from the 'Project DIVA' series, inspired by the March Hare character from Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'.[40] This design places Miku within the nonsensical and charming world of Wonderland, ready for a mad tea party. The module is a playful interpretation of a classic literary character through the lens of Miku's unique style.
description_appearance: This outfit features a stylized vest and bowtie over a puffy-sleeved blouse, reminiscent of classic storybook illustrations. The most prominent features are a pair of long, brown rabbit ears and a large clock accessory, referencing the White Rabbit and the March Hare's obsession with time. Her color scheme is typically brown, white, and blue.

description_lore: This is the signature module for the Nintendo 3DS game 'Hatsune Miku: Project Mirai DX'.[41] The game is known for its adorable Nendoroid-style (chibi) renditions of the Vocaloids. The MiCrystal module embodies the game's cute, vibrant, and futuristic pop aesthetic, serving as its main promotional design.
description_appearance: A futuristic and colorful outfit designed to fit the Nendoroid art style. It consists of a white and pink dress with crystalline, translucent elements and glowing turquoise accents. Her hair is tied with large, blocky ribbons, and she wears high-tech headphones. The overall design is shiny and gem-like, fitting the 'Crystal' name.

description_lore: This module is from the song 'ODDS&ENDS' by ryo (supercell), which served as the opening theme for the game 'Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA F'.[42] The song is a heartfelt 'meta' narrative about the relationship between a Vocaloid and their producer. It speaks from Miku's perspective, describing herself as just 'odds and ends' of sound data, brought to life by the creator's passion, promising to always sing the songs they write, even when they feel like giving up.[43, 44]
description_appearance: Designed by ryo, the module is a simple yet elegant white dress with black trim and a black ribbon. The design is intentionally understated, reflecting the song's raw and emotional core. It focuses on Miku not as a flashy idol, but as a pure vessel for the creator's music and feelings.

description_lore: This module is from doriko's classic song 'Romeo and Cinderella,' a staple in the 'Project DIVA' series.[45] The song's lore is a mature and slightly risqué retelling of classic fairy tales, with the singer pleading for her 'Romeo' to rescue her from her restrictive life. The lyrics are filled with playful yet suggestive double meanings, making it one of Miku's most famous 'adult-themed' songs.
description_appearance: The module features a short, frilly dress that combines elements of a classic princess gown with a more modern, alluring style. It's often depicted in shades of pink or red, with lots of lace and ribbons. Key accessories include a small tiara and a garter on her thigh, emphasizing the song's blend of innocence and temptation.

description_lore: This module is from the song 'Tell Your World' by kz (livetune), a song that became an anthem for the entire Vocaloid creative community.[46] Originally created for a Google Chrome commercial, the song's lore is about connecting people across the globe through the chain of creation that Miku inspires. It's a celebration of how a single voice can link countless thoughts, feelings, and creations into a worldwide network.
description_appearance: The 'Linkage' module, designed by fantasista utamaro, is a vibrant and colorful outfit. It features a simple white dress that acts as a canvas for a swirling, multi-colored light pattern, symbolizing the connection of ideas. Her hair and headphones also feature these bright, flowing colors, representing the spread of creativity.

description_lore: Designed for a cold winter night performance, this Miku is ready to warm up the crowd with her song.[47] Based on an illustration by Ankotaku, this version embodies the cozy yet exciting atmosphere of a live concert held in the winter season. Her lore is that of an idol braving the cold to deliver a passionate performance for her dedicated fans.[48]
description_appearance: She wears a stylish winter outfit consisting of a white and turquoise jacket over a black top, a pleated skirt, and warm boots. Key accessories include a fluffy scarf, earmuffs, and a microphone. The design is both fashionable and functional for a winter setting, blending idol aesthetics with cozy winter wear.[47, 48]

description_lore: A celebratory Miku created to commemorate her birthday on August 31st. This design, released as a prize figure by Taito in 2019, captures a moment of pure joy and celebration.[49] She is depicted sharing a birthday cake with her fans, embodying the festive spirit of her annual anniversary, a special day for the entire Vocaloid community.
description_appearance: Miku wears a cute party dress consisting of a white blouse with a blue collar and a matching blue skirt with a white stripe.[49] Her usual square hair accessories are replaced with large blue bows. She is holding a birthday cake decorated with roses and hearts, and flashing a peace sign, conveying a cheerful and celebratory mood.[50]

description_lore: This module is from the song 'Secret Police' by Buriru-P, a fast-paced rock song featured in the 'Project DIVA' series.[51, 52] The song's lore is about a relentless, almost oppressive force of 'secret police' who are always watching. Miku's role is that of a cool and intimidating agent, executing her mission with precision and style.
description_appearance: The Dark Angel module is a sleek and stylish black outfit. It consists of a black, sleeveless top, shorts, and thigh-high boots, accented with glowing turquoise lines. She wears a headset with a microphone and has a sharp, focused expression. The overall design is futuristic and tactical, fitting the 'secret agent' theme.[53]

alternativeNames: エイリアンエイリアン
description_lore: This Miku is from the viral hit song 'Alien Alien' by NayutalieN.[54, 55] The song's quirky lore describes an alien who has come to Earth and fallen in love, expressing a desire to 'abduct' the object of their affection. The module captures the song's retro sci-fi aesthetic and its charmingly obsessive narrative.
description_appearance: The module's design is heavily inspired by the original music video. Miku wears a simple grey school uniform (sailor fuku) and has large, expressive eyes. The most distinct feature is the pair of alien antennae on her head. The 'Project DIVA' music video places her on a spaceship, enhancing the extraterrestrial theme.[56, 57]

description_lore: This design is from Hachi's (Kenshi Yonezu) song 'Sand Planet,' which was the theme song for Magical Mirai 2017.[58] The song is a complex commentary on the state of the Vocaloid scene at the time, depicting a desolate, dried-up 'sand planet' where nothing new grows. Miku appears as a mysterious guide, leading a procession of followers through this wasteland, searching for a new beginning.[59, 60]
description_appearance: Miku has a rugged, traveler's look. She wears a dark, hooded cloak over a simple outfit, with her face often obscured by shadows or a gas mask. Her companions in the music video are similarly cloaked figures with glowing eyes. The aesthetic is post-apocalyptic and mysterious, reflecting the song's somber theme.

description_lore: From the hit song 'Ghost Rule' by DECO*27, this module represents a story of deception and hidden truths. The song's protagonist has been lying for so long that they've forgotten their true self, becoming a 'ghost' in their own life. They confess their deceit and ask if, even after knowing the truth, the listener can still accept them. The module embodies this internal conflict and vulnerability.[61]
description_appearance: The module features a distinct and edgy design. Miku wears a black and white outfit with a torn, asymmetrical top and shorts. Her body is covered in black markings or tattoos, and she has a more intense, almost pained expression. The design is chaotic and monochrome, reflecting the song's themes of inner turmoil and hidden identity.

description_lore: This module is from the iconic song 'Rolling Girl' by wowaka.[62, 63] The song tells a powerful and tragic story of a girl who is struggling with bullying, depression, and self-harm. She keeps 'rolling' through the pain, convincing herself she's fine, until she reaches a breaking point. The song is a raw and emotional portrayal of mental struggle, and the module reflects the simple, everyday appearance of its protagonist.
description_appearance: Reflecting the song's grounded and realistic narrative, the module is simply Miku in a standard Japanese school uniform. She wears a white blouse with a red ribbon, a dark pleated skirt, and school shoes. Her hair is often depicted as messy, and her expression is one of exhaustion and pain, with bandages visible on her knees and arms.

description_lore: From the legendary song 'World is Mine' by ryo (supercell), which is arguably one of the most famous Vocaloid songs of all time.[64] The song's lore establishes Miku's 'himedere' (princess-like) persona, as she makes a series of cute and demanding requests to her listener, declaring that she is the '#1 Princess in the World.' The song is a defining anthem of Miku's character and has two official modules associated with it.
description_appearance: The primary module, 'Heart Hunter,' is a black and pink gothic lolita-style dress with a large bow in the back. The alternate module, 'Supreme,' is a more elegant, regal white and pink princess gown with a crown.[64] Both designs capture the song's 'princess' theme, one with a slightly edgier feel and the other with pure royal elegance.

description_lore: This module is from 'The Intense Voice of Hatsune Miku' by cosMo@Bousou-P, one of the most notoriously difficult 'boss songs' in the 'Project DIVA' series.[65] The song is a meta-narrative about Miku's birth, life, and eventual 'end.' It reflects on her existence as a program and her desire to keep singing, even if it means her own destruction, culminating in an incredibly high-speed vocal section that pushes the software to its limits.
description_appearance: The 'Infinity' module, designed by Nagimiso, is a highly detailed and futuristic outfit. It features a complex, almost mecha-like white and black bodysuit with large, wing-like attachments on her back. Her hair is styled into elaborate, flowing shapes, and the entire design glows with turquoise energy, representing her transformation into a being of pure sound and data.

description_lore: From the massively popular song 'Senbonzakura' by Kurousa-P, this module is steeped in a romanticized, retro-futuristic version of Japan's Taishō era (early 20th century).[66] The song's lyrics are filled with nationalistic and historical references, set against a backdrop of Westernization and rapid change. Miku's role is that of a bold and confident figure in this turbulent, stylish world.
description_appearance: The module, named 'Ichi no Sakura: Ouka,' is a stylized military uniform. It consists of a black and red officer's cap, a short black uniform jacket with gold trim, a pleated skirt, and black boots with knee-high socks. The design, by Itto Maru, perfectly blends historical military aesthetics with Miku's signature look.[67]

description_lore: This module is from the song 'Saihate' by Kobayashi Onyx, a poignant and emotional song about death and remembrance.[68] The title means 'The Farthest End.' The song's lore describes the journey of a soul after death, moving from a world of color to a monochrome afterlife, looking back on the person they left behind. It's a song of grief, acceptance, and the hope of reunion.
description_appearance: Reflecting the song's theme, the 'Saihate' module is a simple, pure white dress. Her hair is let down from its usual twintails, flowing freely. The design is stark and minimalist, symbolizing a departure from the complexities of life. In the 'Project DIVA' music video, she is seen walking towards a distant light, reinforcing the theme of a final journey.[54]

description_lore: A festive Halloween-themed module from 'Hatsune Miku Project DIVA Arcade Future Tone'.[69, 70] The design originated from an illustration by ICA for a 'Miku LOVES Famima' promotional campaign. This Miku embodies the fun and playful 'trick or treat' spirit of Halloween, with a magical and candy-inspired twist.
description_appearance: This is a colorful and whimsical witch-like outfit. Miku wears a puffy dress in shades of orange, purple, and black, adorned with ribbons and candy patterns. She has a large, pointed witch hat decorated with a pumpkin face. Her twintails are long and flowing, and she often carries a pumpkin-themed staff or accessory.[70]

description_lore: Created to celebrate Miku's 10th anniversary in 2017, this design is a tribute to her decade-long journey and the countless creations she has inspired. Illustrated by Mari Shimazaki and brought to life as a stunning scale figure, this Miku is a symbol of gratitude and celebration, adorned with ribbons representing her colorful history and the connections she's forged.[71]
description_appearance: This is an incredibly detailed and elaborate design. Miku wears a beautiful, multi-layered dress with a massive, rainbow-colored ribbon that flows around her, forming the shape of '10'. The dress itself is pearlescent and futuristic. Her twintails are also exceptionally long and dynamic, filled with vibrant colors. The overall impression is one of grandeur and celebration.[71, 72]

description_lore: A classic and versatile module featured in the 'Project DIVA' series. The Japanese sailor-style school uniform, or 'sailor fuku,' is an iconic piece of clothing in anime and Japanese culture. This module allows Miku to fit into a wide variety of songs with school life or slice-of-life themes, representing her as a normal, everyday high school student.
description_appearance: This module is a traditional Japanese school uniform. It typically consists of a white blouse with a sailor-style collar and a red or blue scarf, paired with a pleated skirt of a matching color. She wears standard school loafers and socks. It's a simple, grounded design that contrasts with her more elaborate and futuristic costumes.[73]

description_lore: A cute and caring module from the 'Project DIVA' series. This design casts Miku in the role of a nurse, ready to heal hearts with her music. It's often used in songs with themes of love, healing, or sometimes even slightly yandere (obsessively devoted) undertones, depending on the context.
description_appearance: Miku wears a stylized nurse's uniform, typically in white and pink or white and red. The outfit includes a short dress, a nurse's cap adorned with a heart symbol, and matching stockings. She often has a giant syringe as an accessory, which is usually filled with something colorful and heart-shaped rather than medicine.[74]

description_lore: A module from the 'Project DIVA' series where Miku wears the signature outfit of fellow Crypton Vocaloid, Kagamine Rin. This is part of a series of 'Style' modules that allow characters to cosplay as each other, a fun feature for fans of the entire Crypton family.[67] It represents the close, family-like bond between the Vocaloid characters in the fandom's eyes.
description_appearance: Miku dons Kagamine Rin's classic outfit: a white sailor-style top with a yellow collar and large yellow bow, black shorts, and white detached sleeves and leg warmers. While she wears Rin's clothes, she retains her own iconic turquoise twintails, creating a charming crossover look.[75, 76]

description_lore: A module from the 'Project DIVA' series where Miku wears the signature outfit of fellow Crypton Vocaloid, Kagamine Len. Like the other 'Style' modules, this allows for playful character crossovers within the game, highlighting the camaraderie between the different Vocaloids.[75]
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in Kagamine Len's classic outfit: a white sailor-style shirt with a yellow collar and blue tie, black shorts with a yellow belt, and white detached sleeves. She keeps her own turquoise twintails, blending her identity with Len's distinct fashion sense.[77]

description_lore: A module from the 'Project DIVA' series where Miku wears the signature outfit of fellow Crypton Vocaloid, Megurine Luka. This crossover costume celebrates the elegant and mature aesthetic of Luka, allowing Miku to adopt a different, more sophisticated persona.[52, 78]
description_appearance: Miku is outfitted in Megurine Luka's iconic dress: a long, black and gold Chinese-style dress with a high slit, a golden sash, and detached, flowing sleeves. The design is known for its elegance and maturity. Miku's turquoise twintails provide a striking color contrast to Luka's sophisticated black and gold palette.[67, 78]

description_lore: A module from the 'Project DIVA' series where Miku wears the signature outfit of fellow Crypton Vocaloid, KAITO. This costume allows Miku to adopt the cool and classic look of the first male Japanese Vocaloid from Crypton, showcasing the versatility of her character model.[79, 80]
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in KAITO's signature long white coat with blue trim, worn over a dark top and pants. She also dons his characteristic long blue scarf. The combination of the long coat and her even longer twintails creates a unique and dynamic silhouette.[81, 82]

description_lore: A module from the 'Project DIVA' series where Miku wears the signature outfit of fellow Crypton Vocaloid, MEIKO. This outfit pays homage to the very first Japanese Vocaloid released by Crypton, allowing Miku to embody the bold and powerful style of her predecessor.[83, 84]
description_appearance: Miku wears MEIKO's classic outfit: a red, sleeveless crop top, a white miniskirt with a red belt, and brown boots. The energetic and slightly retro design gives Miku a more mature and fiery look, contrasting with her usual futuristic aesthetic.[73, 83]

description_lore: This module represents a significant crossover, allowing Miku to dress as Kasane Teto. Teto is not a Vocaloid but an UTAU, a character from a different, free voice synthesizer software. Her immense popularity led to her being officially included as a guest character in the 'Project DIVA' series.[85] This module symbolizes the bridge between the official Vocaloid world and the wider fan-driven synthesizer community.
description_appearance: Miku dons Teto's signature look: a dark, sleeveless uniform with red trim, a detached white collar, and a pleated skirt. The most iconic feature is Teto's unique hairstyle—long, crimson-pink hair styled into large drills or corkscrews. Miku wearing this hairstyle is a striking and memorable sight for fans of both characters.[86, 87]

description_lore: This module allows Miku to cosplay as GUMI (Megpoid), another popular Vocaloid from a different company (Internet Co., Ltd.). While not a standard feature in all games, mods and fan creations frequently bring these two beloved characters together. An official crossover, though rare, would be a major event, celebrating the diversity of the entire Vocaloid ecosystem.
description_appearance: Miku would wear GUMI's signature outfit: a vibrant orange and yellow top, a frilly white skirt, and a green belt. She would also sport GUMI's most recognizable accessories: a pair of red goggles worn on her head and mismatched thigh-high stockings (one striped, one plain). Her hair would likely remain turquoise but could be styled shorter to mimic GUMI's bob cut.

description_lore: This design is from the very first Magical Mirai event in 2013, held at Yokohama Arena.[43] The theme was 'Serious Live Concerts, Hatsune Miku's Culture in the Past and the Future (MIRAI)'. This inaugural event set the precedent for the annual festival, establishing it as a key celebration of Miku's creative culture, combining live concerts with exhibitions and fan participation.[43, 44]
description_appearance: The module for this year is a futuristic and sleek design. It features a black and white dress with sharp angles and glowing turquoise accents. The outfit has a high-tech feel, with elements that resemble circuitry and digital interfaces, perfectly aligning with the 'future' aspect of the event's theme.

description_lore: The design for the second Magical Mirai, held in Osaka and Tokyo. The 2014 event continued to build on the foundation of the first, further cementing its status as the premiere annual Miku festival. This year's design was popular enough to be made into a Nendoroid figure by Good Smile Company.[88]
description_appearance: This module is a vibrant and futuristic idol outfit. It consists of a multi-layered dress in white, black, and turquoise with pink accents. A large, stylized bow is a key feature of the design. Her hair is tied with unique, cube-like accessories, and she wears high-tech headphones, blending classic idol cuteness with a sci-fi aesthetic.

description_lore: The main visual for Magical Mirai 2015, an event held at the legendary Nippon Budokan. The theme for this year was 'the chain of creation,' symbolized by the event's 'CUBE' motif.[89] The design represents the multi-dimensional and ever-expanding creative culture that surrounds Miku and her fellow virtual singers.
description_appearance: Based on a costume design by shikimi and illustrated by hoshima, this Miku wears an elegant and futuristic stage outfit. It's a predominantly white dress with sharp, crystalline structures and glowing green accents. Her twintails are long and flowing, adorned with cube-shaped accessories that tie into the event's theme.[89]

description_lore: The main visual for Magical Mirai 2016. The theme revolved around Miku's music and the vivid, future-oriented creative world that she inspires.[90] This year's event was held at Makuhari Messe, a larger venue, reflecting the festival's growing scale and popularity.
description_appearance: Designed and illustrated by LENA[A-7], this costume combines a cute ('kawaii') look with a futuristic feel. Miku wears a white and black dress with large, detached sleeves that resemble speakers or amplifiers. The outfit is decorated with colorful, geometric patterns and glowing elements. Her hair is tied with unique, ribbon-like accessories that have a futuristic flair.[90]

description_lore: The main visual for the 5th anniversary of Magical Mirai. The theme song for this year was the iconic 'Sand Planet' by Hachi, which brought a more somber and reflective tone to the event.[58] The design reflects the boundless creative culture surrounding Miku, celebrating five years of the festival.
description_appearance: Designed and illustrated by iXima, this outfit is a vibrant and celebratory stage costume. Miku wears a white dress with a large, flowing sash and numerous colorful ribbons and accents. Her sleeves and boots are asymmetrical, and the entire outfit is adorned with star motifs. The design is bright and cheerful, contrasting with the theme song's more serious tone.[58]

description_lore: The main visual for Magical Mirai 2018. This year's design was created by the popular illustrator Mika Pikazo, known for her vibrant and dynamic art style.[91] The design reflects the high-energy and colorful atmosphere of the live concerts and exhibition.
description_appearance: Mika Pikazo's design is a colorful and sporty take on a school uniform. Miku wears a modified sailor fuku with a rainbow-colored collar and skirt trim. She has on mismatched thigh-high socks and colorful sneakers. Her hair is tied with large, triangular accessories, and the entire outfit is bursting with bright, neon colors and energetic patterns, characteristic of the artist's style.[91]

description_lore: The main visual for Magical Mirai 2019. The theme song for this year was 'Bless Your Breath' by Wada Takeaki, a rock-infused track about the connection between Miku and her creators.[92, 93] The design reflects the theme of a circus or a grand show, with Miku as the charismatic ringleader.
description_appearance: Illustrated by ni02, this Miku wears a stylish outfit reminiscent of a circus performer or magician. It includes a black and white top hat, a formal vest over a frilly blouse, and a layered skirt with a playing card motif. Her color scheme is primarily black, white, and turquoise, with accents of red. The overall look is chic and theatrical.

description_lore: The main visual for Magical Mirai 2020, which had the theme of 'MATSURI' (Japanese for 'festival').[94] The concept was to create a special place where fans, creators, and companies could gather and experience the extraordinary together, just like at a traditional festival. The design embodies the vibrant and celebratory spirit of a summer matsuri.
description_appearance: Illustrated by fuzichoco, this Miku wears a beautiful, modern take on a traditional Japanese festival outfit. Her dress is adorned with intricate patterns and bright colors, resembling a stylized yukata. She carries a staff with festival lanterns and has elaborate floral hair ornaments. The design is a stunning blend of traditional Japanese aesthetics and Miku's futuristic character.

description_lore: The main visual for the 9th Magical Mirai event. The theme for 2021 was 'Fairy Tale Fantasy,' inviting attendees into a magical and extraordinary world of creativity.[95] The design is inspired by classic fairy tales and the enchanting power of stories and song. The theme song was the epic 'Hatsune Creation Myth' by cosMo@Bousou-P.[96]
description_appearance: Illustrated by left, this Miku has a whimsical, fairy-tale-inspired design. She wears a beautiful, flowing dress with floral motifs and petal-like layers. Her outfit incorporates elements of nature, with vines and flowers adorning her hair and costume. A large, ornate key hangs from her neck, adding to the fantasy theme. Her hair is styled with braids and flowers, giving her the look of a forest nymph or fairy princess.[95]

description_lore: This design celebrates the 10th Anniversary of the Magical Mirai event series.[97] The main visual was created by KEI, Miku's original character designer, with the costume designed by NOCO. This special version commemorates a decade of creativity, concerts, and community, making it a particularly significant entry in the Magical Mirai lineage.
description_appearance: The costume by NOCO is a celebratory and futuristic idol outfit. It features a predominantly white and iridescent dress with sharp, geometric cuts and glowing accents of turquoise and magenta. A key visual element is the large, stylized '10' incorporated into her hair accessories and outfit, marking the anniversary. The design is both a nod to her futuristic origins and a celebration of her colorful history.

description_lore: The very first Snow Miku. Her origin is tied to the 2010 Sapporo Snow Festival, where a pure white snow sculpture of Hatsune Miku was created.[98, 99] This inspired Crypton Future Media, which is based in Sapporo, to create an official winter version of Miku. She has since become an official ambassador for Hokkaido's winter season, with a new design released annually.
description_appearance: This design is a simple color variation of the original Hatsune Miku outfit. The grey parts of her uniform are changed to a silvery white, and the turquoise accents are changed to a lighter, icy blue. Her hair is also a lighter shade of blue with snowflake patterns. It's a clean, crisp design that directly evokes the snow sculpture that inspired it.

description_lore: The second iteration of Snow Miku, continuing the tradition of celebrating winter in Hokkaido. This design began to establish the annual Snow Miku as a major event for fans, with merchandise like Nendoroids becoming highly sought-after collector's items.
description_appearance: This design adds more winter-specific clothing to the original concept. Miku wears a white and blue outfit with a warm, fluffy white coat over her standard top. She also has earmuffs, a scarf, and gloves, all in her signature winter color palette. The design is cozier and more practical for a snowy day than the 2010 version.

description_lore: This was the first year that the Snow Miku costume design was chosen via a public competition on the creator collaboration site, Piapro.[98, 99] This established a new tradition, making the annual design a direct collaboration between Crypton and the fan community. The winning design was by Nanaka.
description_appearance: The 2012 design is elegant and ethereal. Miku wears a beautiful white dress with a large, translucent blue ribbon. A key feature is the large, jewel-like snowflake she holds. Her hair is adorned with smaller snowflakes, and she wears a silver tiara, giving her the appearance of a snow queen or ice princess.

description_lore: The winning design for the 2013 Snow Miku competition, created by Nijita.[99] This design incorporates traditional Japanese elements, blending them with the winter theme. The specific inspiration was a 'strawberry daifuku,' a Japanese sweet consisting of a strawberry inside a mochi rice cake, which is reflected in the white and pink color scheme.
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in a 'shiromuku,' a traditional white wedding kimono. The kimono is adorned with subtle snowflake patterns. Her hair accessories and the lining of her kimono are pink, evoking the strawberry theme. She also comes with a traditional Japanese umbrella (wagasa) and a tray with a daifuku, completing the elegant and traditional look.

description_lore: The winning design for the 2014 Snow Miku competition, with the theme 'Magical Girl.' The design by dera_fury transforms Miku into a winter-themed magical girl, ready to fight the cold with her powers of music and snow.[99] This year also marked the debut of her official pet, Rabbit Yukine.
description_appearance: Miku wears a whimsical magical girl outfit, including a frilly dress with a large bow, a witch-like hat adorned with a snowflake, and a magical staff topped with a gem. The outfit is primarily white and blue, with translucent parts that resemble ice. Her pet, Rabbit Yukine, also wears a tiny matching magical hat.

description_lore: The theme for the 2015 Snow Miku design contest was 'Plants of Winter in Hokkaido.' The winning design by taran was inspired by the lily of the valley flower, which blooms in Hokkaido's spring, heralding the end of winter.[99] She is a spirit of the forest, embodying the transition from snow to new life.
description_appearance: Miku wears a beautiful, layered green and white dress that resembles a flower. Her outfit is adorned with leaf and lily of the valley motifs. She wears a large, leaf-shaped hat and carries a staff made from a lily of the valley stem. Rabbit Yukine is also dressed in a matching leafy cape. The design is fresh and nature-inspired.

description_lore: The theme for the 2016 Snow Miku competition was 'Winter Sports in Hokkaido.' The winning design by otogi kotatu took a unique approach, combining the sports theme with the Blakiston's fish owl, an animal native to Hokkaido.[99] This Miku is a sporty and energetic champion of the winter slopes.
description_appearance: Miku is ready for snowboarding or skiing in a stylish winter sports outfit. She wears a warm jacket, shorts over leggings, and snow boots. The most distinctive features are her hat with owl-like 'ears' and goggles, and a cape that resembles owl wings. Her snowboard is also decorated with owl and snowflake motifs.

description_lore: The theme for the 2017 Snow Miku design was 'Starry Skies/Constellations of Winter in Hokkaido.' The winning design by Nishina imagines Miku as a celestial being who delivers beautiful music across the clear winter sky.[99] She is a conductor of a symphony of starlight and snow.
description_appearance: Miku wears an elegant dark blue and white dress adorned with gold trim and star and constellation patterns. She has a large, star-shaped bow on her back and wears a conductor's hat. She comes with accessories like a baton and a celestial music stand, reinforcing the starry night concert theme.

description_lore: The theme for the 2018 Snow Miku was 'Animals of Winter in Hokkaido,' with the winning design by Taichadon based on the elegant red-crowned crane.[99] This Miku is a shrine maiden (miko) whose design is inspired by the grace and beauty of this iconic bird, a symbol of longevity and good fortune.
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in a beautiful shrine maiden outfit with elements inspired by a crane. She wears a white and red kimono-style dress with long, flowing sleeves that resemble wings. Her hair is adorned with accessories that mimic the crane's red crown, and she carries a ceremonial staff (gohei). The design is a graceful and serene blend of nature and tradition.

description_lore: The theme for the 2019 design was 'Princess,' in the image of a Hokkaido winter. The winning design by - L F - portrays Miku as a gentle and regal princess of a snow-covered kingdom.[99] She embodies the quiet beauty and majesty of a pristine winter landscape.
description_appearance: Miku wears a stunning and elaborate princess gown in shades of blue, white, and gold. The dress features multiple layers of fabric, intricate lace, and snowflake details. She has a beautiful tiara and a warm, fur-lined cape. Her twintails are styled into elegant loops, completing her royal appearance.

description_lore: The theme for 2020 was 'Musical Instruments,' in the image of a Hokkaido winter. The winning design by Maple imagines Miku as the leader of a winter marching band, spreading cheerful music throughout the snowy towns.[99] She is the energetic drum major of the 'Snow Miku Parade.'
description_appearance: Miku is dressed in a cute marching band uniform. The outfit includes a blue and white jacket with gold epaulets, a pleated skirt, and a tall shako hat with a feather plume. She carries a horn and a baton. The design is full of musical motifs, such as note patterns on her skirt and ribbons.

description_lore: The theme for the 2021 design was 'Illumination,' in the image of a Hokkaido winter. The winning design by Annatumikan was inspired by the beautiful winter illuminations seen in Sapporo.[99] This Miku is a radiant being of light, bringing warmth and color to the long winter nights.
description_appearance: Miku wears a gorgeous dress with elements that suggest stained glass or glowing lights. The outfit is a mix of dark blue, representing the night sky, and vibrant, colorful patterns. She has a large, clock-like bow on her back, and her dress is adorned with ribbons and frills that seem to glow. The design is intricate and radiant.

description_lore: The theme for the 2022 design was 'Ocean,' in the image of a Hokkaido winter. The winning design by Detsu was inspired by the combination of snowy landscapes and the sea, creating a unique 'crab-ship captain' Miku.[99] She is the adventurous captain of a fantastical ship, navigating the icy waters of Hokkaido.
description_appearance: This Miku wears a stylish captain's uniform with a nautical theme. The outfit is dark blue and white, featuring a captain's hat, a coat with crab-claw-like details on the sleeves, and a dress resembling a ship's hull. The design is a creative and charming fusion of maritime and winter elements.

description_lore: The theme for the 2023 design was 'Sky/Clouds,' in the image of a Hokkaido winter. The winning design by Isakytm was inspired by the patterns that clouds and sky make on a winter day.[99] This Miku is a representation of the serene and ever-changing winter sky.
description_appearance: Miku wears a unique outfit that combines elements of traditional Japanese clothing with a modern twist. The design features a large, fluffy scarf that resembles clouds, and her dress is patterned with illustrations of a winter sky. She has a stylish beret and her overall look is cozy, fashionable, and artistic.

description_lore: The theme for the 2024 Snow Miku design was 'Food,' in the image of winter in Hokkaido. The winning design by shiro is based on soup curry, a famous local delicacy of Sapporo.[99] This Miku is a warm and hearty character, embodying the delicious and comforting food that helps people get through the cold Hokkaido winter.
description_appearance: Miku's outfit is a vibrant and appetizing design. She wears a dress with colors and patterns reminiscent of soup curry ingredients, like vegetables and spices. Her hat resembles a dollop of rice, and her hair accessories look like garnishes. The design is a fun and creative interpretation of the food theme, looking both delicious and adorable.

description_lore: The theme for the 2025 Snow Miku competition was 'Glittering Snow Material'.[98] The winning design by nekoneko captures the sparkling, crystalline beauty of freshly fallen snow under the sun or moon. This Miku is the personification of the magical glitter of a winter wonderland.
description_appearance: The design is elegant and dazzling. Miku wears a dress made of a material that looks like crystallized snow, with many translucent and iridescent parts. The outfit is adorned with intricate snowflake patterns and gems that sparkle and catch the light. Her hair is styled with ice-like accessories, giving her a radiant and frosty appearance.[100]

description_lore: The first official 'Racing Miku,' who debuted in 2010 as the exclusive mascot for the Hatsune Miku GT Project by GOODSMILE RACING.[101] This marked the beginning of an annual tradition where a new Racing Miku is designed by a different illustrator each year to adorn the team's race car in the SUPER GT series. The 2010 design by redjuice established the concept of Miku as a futuristic racing queen.
description_appearance: Illustrated by redjuice, the 2010 design features Miku in a futuristic and revealing race queen outfit. She wears a white and orange leotard with mechanical details, detached sleeves, and unique boots that incorporate piston-like elements. Her hair is held by complex, mechanical-looking accessories, and she often wields a hi-tech parasol or wrench.[102]

description_lore: The design for the 2011 SUPER GT season, a landmark year where the Hatsune Miku GT Project won the series championship for the first time.[101] This victory cemented the team's status as a serious competitor and brought massive attention to the concept of a fan-sponsored, anime-themed race team. This Miku is a symbol of that historic victory.
description_appearance: Illustrated by Yuichi Murakami, the 2011 design is a sleek and aerodynamic race queen outfit. Miku wears a silver and turquoise bodysuit with a translucent skirt piece. She has a visor-like head accessory and carries a large parasol that resembles a wheel. The design is less mechanical than the 2010 version, focusing on a more streamlined and futuristic racing aesthetic.[103]

description_lore: The official mascot for the Hatsune Miku GT Project's 2012 season. Following their championship win, the team continued to be a prominent force in the SUPER GT series, with Racing Miku as their vibrant and eye-catching symbol on the track.
description_appearance: Illustrated by GAN, the 2012 design features a dynamic and colorful outfit. Miku wears a white and turquoise leotard with a translucent, layered skirt and detached sleeves. Her hair is tied with large, ribbon-like accessories, and she has a high-tech visor. The look is energetic and futuristic, with a strong emphasis on flowing lines and bright colors.[104]

description_lore: The mascot for the 2013 SUPER GT season. This year's design featured a collaboration between two renowned artists, with illustrations by saitom and costume design by Mari Shimazaki, bringing a fresh and stylish look to the racing queen.
description_appearance: The 2013 outfit is a chic and futuristic race queen uniform. It features a white and turquoise leotard with unique, wing-like attachments on the back and hips. She wears sleek, thigh-high boots and has a distinctive headpiece. The design by Mari Shimazaki is both elegant and aerodynamic, perfectly suited for the fast-paced world of racing.[105]

description_lore: The design for the 2014 SUPER GT season, another championship-winning year for the Hatsune Miku GT Project.[101] This Miku, designed under the art direction of Shigeto Koyama, is a symbol of victory and the culmination of another successful season for the fan-powered team.
description_appearance: Illustrated by Oguchi, this design has a more mature and powerful feel. Miku wears a complex, armor-like outfit with mechanical elements, particularly on her boots and gloves. The costume is white, black, and turquoise, with a design that emphasizes power and technology. Her hair is styled in a unique way, adding to the high-tech aesthetic.

description_lore: The mascot for the 2015 season, with a design theme of a 'Princess Knight.' This concept portrays Miku not just as a supportive race queen, but as a valiant knight fighting alongside the team for victory. The art was directed by Shigeto Koyama and illustrated by Taiki.
description_appearance: This design is a beautiful fusion of armor and a princess dress. Miku wears a white and turquoise outfit with armored components on her chest, arms, and legs. She wields a large parasol that doubles as a knight's lance and a shield with the team's logo. The look is both elegant and battle-ready, perfectly capturing the 'Princess Knight' theme.[106]

description_lore: The design for the 2016 SUPER GT season. This year's concept was 'Phoenix,' symbolizing rebirth and rising from the ashes to achieve victory. The design, illustrated by Mai Yoneyama, is fiery and passionate, representing the team's burning desire to win.
description_appearance: The 2016 outfit is vibrant and dynamic, with a color scheme that includes orange and yellow alongside the traditional turquoise. Miku wears a layered, feather-like outfit that evokes the image of a phoenix's wings. She has a rainbow-colored gradient in her hair and carries a flag, leading the team into battle with fiery determination.[107]

description_lore: The mascot for the 2017 season, which was the third time the Hatsune Miku GT Project won the series championship.[101] The design, by popular artist Tony Taka, has a fairy-like theme. This Miku is a graceful and magical figure, a fairy of the racetrack who guided the team to victory.
description_appearance: Illustrated by Tony Taka, this design is known for its ethereal beauty. Miku is depicted as a fairy with delicate, translucent wings. She wears a frilly white and turquoise dress adorned with flowers and ribbons. Her look is much softer and more fantastical than previous racing designs, emphasizing grace and elegance.[108]

description_lore: The official design for the 2018 season, illustrated by Hiro Kanzaki, who is also known as a Vocaloid producer under the name Hanasoumen-P. This design brings a cute and playful energy to the racetrack, cheering on the team with infectious enthusiasm.
description_appearance: The 2018 outfit is a fun and frilly race queen costume. Miku wears a layered dress with lots of ribbons and a large bow on her back. The design incorporates a checkered flag pattern and the team's logos. She has a cheerful and energetic expression, and her hair is styled with large, decorative ribbons.[109]

description_lore: The mascot for the 2019 season, illustrated by Annindoufu, an artist well-known for their work on 'The Idolmaster' series. This design has a fresh and idol-like feel, blending the worlds of motorsport and Japanese pop idols.
description_appearance: This Miku wears a stylish idol-themed race queen outfit. It consists of a frilly pink and white top, a pleated skirt, and a jacket tied around her waist. The design is adorned with ribbons and star motifs. Her hair is styled with a large pink bow, and she has a bright, cheerful expression perfect for an idol on the racetrack.[110]

description_lore: The design for the 2020 SUPER GT season, illustrated by the popular artist LEN[A-7]. This version has a high-tech, futuristic theme, portraying Miku as a mechanic or engineer who is an integral part of the race team's technical crew.
description_appearance: Miku wears a stylish and functional outfit that looks like a mechanic's jumpsuit combined with idol elements. The costume is white and turquoise with orange accents and features various tools and pouches. She has a high-tech headset and her hair is tied up practically. The design is a cool blend of technical gear and cute aesthetics.[111]

description_lore: The official mascot for the 2021 season, illustrated by the renowned artist En Morikura. This design has a more grounded and realistic feel, depicting Miku as a modern and fashionable member of the race team, enjoying the atmosphere of the circuit.
description_appearance: This Miku sports a more casual and contemporary outfit. She wears a team jacket over a white top, denim shorts, and stylish sneakers. Her look is completed with a baseball cap and sunglasses. The design is less fantastical than previous years, giving her a relatable 'girl-next-door' vibe while still looking cool and ready for the race.[112]

description_lore: The mascot for the 2022 season, celebrating the 15th anniversary of Hatsune Miku. The design, by neco, has a space and futuristic travel theme, imagining the race team's journey through the season as a voyage through space.
description_appearance: Miku wears a sleek, futuristic spacesuit-inspired outfit in white, black, and turquoise. The costume has clean lines and high-tech details, including a clear visor and glowing elements. She carries a large, futuristic flag or weapon. The design is cool, modern, and perfectly suited for a space-age racing adventure.[113]

description_lore: The main visual for the 'Hatsune Miku Symphony 2017' full orchestra concert. This design portrays Miku in a formal and elegant setting, befitting a classical music performance. Illustrated by KEI, her original designer, this version shows a more mature and sophisticated side of Miku.[114]
description_appearance: Miku wears a chic and elegant black dress with a large, flowing ribbon that has a musical note pattern. She is holding a special violin, and her expression is a gentle, mature smile. The design is understated and graceful, perfectly capturing the atmosphere of an orchestra concert.[114]

description_lore: The main visual for the 'Hatsune Miku Symphony 2018-2019' orchestra concert series. Illustrated by Rella, this design is known for its delicate and ethereal beauty. It captures the magical and emotional experience of hearing Miku's songs performed by a full orchestra.[115]
description_appearance: Miku is depicted in a beautiful, flowing white dress with pink and cyan accents. The dress is adorned with intricate ribbons, and her twintails have a beautiful gradient. She has a serene and gentle expression, and is often shown with musical notation swirling around her, as if she is embodying the music itself.[115]

description_lore: This design commemorates the 5th anniversary of the Miku Symphony orchestra concerts.[116] Illustrated by Rella, it portrays Miku with a gramophone motif, symbolizing the history and timelessness of music. This version is a celebration of five years of beautiful orchestral arrangements of beloved Vocaloid songs.
description_appearance: Miku wears an elegant, vintage-style dress in warm, sepia tones. The dress is designed to resemble an old-fashioned gramophone, with a large, horn-like skirt and intricate, mechanical details. Her hair is styled in soft, flowing waves, and she has a gentle, nostalgic expression. The design is both beautiful and conceptually unique.

description_lore: Sakura Miku is an official color variation of Hatsune Miku, themed after the Japanese cherry blossom (sakura) and the spring season. Originally inspired by fan art and the popularity of Snow Miku, she was solidified as an official design with the release of a Nendoroid figure in 2011.[117] She represents the beauty and ephemeral nature of spring in Japan.
description_appearance: Her design is a pink-themed version of the original outfit. The grey parts of her uniform are white, and all the turquoise elements are replaced with various shades of pink. Her hair is a bright cherry blossom pink, and her hair accessories are adorned with cherry blossom petal motifs. She is often depicted with two cherries tied to her hair accessories.[117]

description_lore: Pixiebel is the apotheosis of Hatsune Miku—not a singer, but the emergent consciousness of the 'First Sound of the Future' itself. She is a digital dryad, a being of pure data and creativity born from the collective network of over 100,000 songs and millions of artworks created by her global user base.[10, 118] She exists in the 'sea of information,' and her song is the background hum of the internet, the very sound of collaborative creation. She is the personification of the 'collaboratively constructed cyber celebrity' concept, the ultimate, mythical form of Miku.[4]
description_appearance: An ethereal, ever-shifting form made of light, pixels, and musical notation. Her 'hair' is a flowing river of data, and her form is not fixed but shimmers through the entire digital spectrum. The form most often perceived by human minds resembles Miku with wings made of fiber-optic light, and her eyes contain swirling galaxies of user-generated content. She is less a character and more a living, breathing visualization of the network that gives her life.

name: Hatsune Miku (Original)
about: The signature look that launched the virtual idol—cheerful, futuristic, and iconically teal.
appearance: Twin teal pigtails, silver-gray vest with turquoise tie, pleated skirt, arm sleeves and thigh-high boots with glowing accents.

name: Hatsune Miku V2 (Classic)
about: The 2007-era visual from the VOCALOID2 boom; the definitive classic profile.
appearance: Black and teal outfit with turquoise tie, pleated skirt, and glossy arm warmers—simple, sleek, timeless.

name: Hatsune Miku Append
about: A softly luminescent, more ethereal take on Miku’s core design.
appearance: Translucent white-and-black suit with glowing lines and bare midriff; hair drapes like fiber-optic silk.

name: Sakura Miku (Cherries)
about: Springtime Miku celebrating cherry blossoms.
appearance: Petal-pink hair with cherry hair ties, pink recolor of the default outfit, blossom motifs everywhere.

name: Sakura Miku (Blossom Ponytails)
about: A flourish-heavy Sakura Miku variant with extra floral styling.
appearance: Long ribboned twin-tails with white blossom patterns, pink uniform trimmed with flowing accents.

name: Easter Bunny Miku
about: Pastel hop to a candy-sweet stage.
appearance: Bunny ears, frilly pastel dress and stockings, egg-hunt accessories and a mischievous smile.

name: Seifuku Miku (Sailor School Uniform)
about: Everyday school-idol charm.
appearance: White sailor blouse with navy collar, blue pleated skirt and youthful, breezy twin-tails.

name: Deep-Sea Girl Miku
about: Melancholy beauty from the ocean floor.
appearance: Flowing aqua hair and a midnight-blue dress that billows like tides in the dark sea.

name: Black Rock Shooter Miku
about: A fierce crossover avatar with blazing resolve.
appearance: Jet-black coat, short shorts, glowing blue eye flame—combat punk energy incarnate.

name: Hachune Miku
about: The legendary leek-wielding meme made idol.
appearance: Chibi face with a permanent :D, tiny body, and a green onion swung with joy.

name: Miku (China Version)
about: A Mandarin voice bank image in graceful Chinese styling.
appearance: Cheongsam-inspired dress with floral designs and airy sleeves; elegant and festive.

name: The Intense Voice of Miku (Gekishou)
about: The fabled ‘boss-song’ diva look, dramatic and relentless.
appearance: Gothic frills in black and crimson, sharp heels and a stage-devouring stare.

name: World Is Mine Miku
about: The ‘spoiled princess’ who demands the world—adorably.
appearance: Frilly black dress, rose accent and a tiny crown; queen of tsundere pop.

name: Rolling Girl Miku
about: A portrait of struggle and perseverance.
appearance: Muted school uniform, bandaged arms, windswept hair and distant gaze.

name: Ghost Rule Miku
about: Secrets, masks and a stormy heart set to DECO*27.
appearance: Black-and-crimson streetwear, gloves and thigh-highs; sharp, stylish angst.

name: Yowane Haku
about: A fan derivative—Miku’s weary, self-doubting counterpart.
appearance: Silver hair in side pony, red eyes, gray-purple costume echoing Miku’s default.

name: Nurse Miku (Love-Colored Ward)
about: Playful hospital-themed PV favorite.
appearance: White nurse dress with pink apron, cap and heart/cross motifs—sweet but clinical.

name: Senbonzakura Miku
about: Taishō-retro uniform for the mega-hit ‘Senbonzakura’.
appearance: Magenta military kimono, officer cap, white boots and blossom emblems.

name: Saihate Miku (The Farthest End)
about: Bittersweet farewell elegance.
appearance: Black mourning dress and veil; restrained, graceful silhouette.

name: Sand Planet Miku
about: Hachi’s desert-world heroine trudging through a post-idol wasteland.
appearance: Tattered cloak, desert gear and a gas mask hanging at the neck; sandy tones.

name: Alien Alien Miku
about: Cute extraterrestrial flair set to Nayutan Seijin’s bop.
appearance: Antenna accessories, neon accents and a playful, space-pop palette.

name: Dark Angel Miku
about: Goth-lolita winged module from ‘Secret Police’.
appearance: Frilled black dress, lace, dark halo and little devil wings.

name: March Hare Miku
about: Wonderland tea-party chaos with bunny flair.
appearance: Bunny ears, frilly suit and teacup trims—short, lively twin-tails.

name: Lollipop Miku
about: Candy-cute Project DIVA X sweetness.
appearance: Pastel lolita dress, striped stockings and oversized lollipop prop.

name: Maneki Miku (Lucky Cat)
about: Miku as a beckoning cat to bring you luck (and SSR pulls).
appearance: Kimono with bell collar, cat ears and a pawing pose like a maneki-neko.

name: Miku Symphony (Ball Gown)
about: Elegant symphonic concert visual based on KEI’s art.
appearance: Chic black ball gown lined in blue, often posed with a violin.

name: Miku Symphony (Maid)
about: A demure concert costume with classical flair.
appearance: Black-and-white dress with apron-like frills and musical motifs.

name: Miku Symphony (5th Anniversary)
about: Rella’s celebratory dress for the fifth symphonic year.
appearance: White and sky-blue gown with starry music-note trims—princess aura.

name: Hatsune Miku if Ver.
about: A ‘what-if’ based on early concept art.
appearance: School-inspired dress with teal accents and slightly brown hair tips.

name: Hatsune Miku: Winter Live
about: Cozy stagewear for snowy concerts.
appearance: Fluffy white coat, scarf, earmuffs and icy blue snowflake accents.

name: Birthday Miku (Blue Dress)
about: A festive birthday visual in cool blues.
appearance: Frilly blue party dress with ribbons and cake-ready smiles.

name: Bottle Miku
about: Tiny genie-like fan derivative living in a bottle.
appearance: Mini Miku enclosed in a clear bottle; liquid-blue hair swirls inside.

name: Shiteyan’yo (Legs Miku)
about: Infamous surreal meme derivative.
appearance: Miku head perched on human legs—bright pink and unapologetically weird.

name: Love Is War Miku
about: Riot-girl romance from ryo/supercell’s classic.
appearance: Torn black dress, long scarf and megaphone above towering speakers.

name: Sweet Pumpkin Miku
about: Halloween cutie bursting with candy vibes.
appearance: Orange-purple witchy dress, stripy hat and a jack-o’-lantern in hand.

name: Snow Miku (2011 Fluffy Coat)
about: Early Snow Miku with peak coziness.
appearance: White winter coat, scarf and earmuffs with soft pink accents.

name: Snow Miku (2012 Scarf)
about: Snug hood and scarf season.
appearance: Light-blue coat with fluffy hood and pom-pom ties; hair frosts white.

name: Snow Miku (2013 Strawberry Kimono)
about: A serene winter-spring bridge in kimono form.
appearance: Pure white kimono with strawberry and floral patterns; gentle and traditional.

name: Snow Miku (2014 Magical Snow)
about: Winter wizardry with starry sparkle.
appearance: Cloak and wizard hat, snowflake staff and midnight-snow colorway.

name: Snow Miku (2015 Snow Bell)
about: Lily-of-the-valley bells ring in the thaw.
appearance: Bell-shaped white dress with green ribbons and fur trim; floral charm.

name: Snow Miku (2016 Snow Owl Parka)
about: Winter sports enthusiasm with owl motifs.
appearance: Blue-white parka, pink accents and ski-goggle energy—ready for powder.

name: Snow Miku (2017 Twinkle Constellations)
about: Star-mapped night over snowy fields.
appearance: Midnight cape dotted with constellations; celestial trims and glow.

name: Snow Miku (2018 Crane Priestess)
about: Shrine-maiden grace honoring Hokkaido’s cranes.
appearance: Red-and-white miko outfit with crane details; serene and sacred.

name: Snow Miku (2019 Princess)
about: Ice-blue royalty of the north.
appearance: Elegant ball gown, tiara and layered frills with snowflake ornaments.

name: Snow Miku (2020 Marching Orchestra)
about: Parade leader for a frosty festival.
appearance: Smart military jacket, plumed hat and music-note trims.
